characters: A THIRD AND FOURTH POLICE CAR AHEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's raining... Light strobes across the wet glass at a rhythmic pace... Suddenly -- through the window a face -- JASON BOURNE -- riding in the backseat -- his gaze fixed. INT. MERCEDES -- NIGHT Al On his knee -- a syringe and a gun -- The eyes of the driver, JARDA, watching -- BOURNE'S POV -- the passenger -- back of his HEAD -- cell phone rings -- the HEAD turns -- it's CONKLIN -- BOURNE returns his stare...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOURNE'S EYES OPEN! -- panicked -- gasping -- trying to stay quiet -- MARIE sleeps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOURNE moving for the medicine cabinet. Digs through the medicine cabinet. Downs something specific.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One minute later. BOURNE moves out onto the veranda. MARIE pads in. Watching him for a moment. Concerned. Clearly it's not the first time this has happened. They both look different than last we saw them; his hair longer. She's a blonde. Hippie travelers. Their cottage is humble but sweet. The bedroom opens to a beach and a town just down the hill. CLUB MUSIC from some all night rave wafting in from the far distance.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Where were you, Jason?

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: In the car. Conklin up front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get the book.

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: No. There's nothing new.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: You're sure? (he nods) We should still -- we should write it down.

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: Two years we're scribbling in a notebook --

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: -- it hasn't been two years --

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: -- it's always bad and it's never anything but bits and pieces anyway! (she's gone quiet) You ever think that maybe it's just making it worse? You don't wonder that? She lays her hands on his shoulders, steadies him.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: We write them down because sooner or later you're going to remember something good.

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: (softens) I do remember something good. All the time. I remember you. She smiles. Kisses him. Leads him back in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARIE getting BOURNE into the bed. Turning down the light Getting him settled. Waiting for that pill to kick in. What would he do without her?

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: I'm trying, Marie, Okay?

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: I worry when you get like this. ee eK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just a nightmare.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: I don't mean that. I worry when you try to ignore it. He hesitates. But that gets him. He knows she's right. And with that opening, he's letting go. Resistance folding. Almost childlike. She's gathering him in. He's letting her do it...

dialogues.speaker: MARIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sleep. Sleep now.

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: I should be better by now.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: You are better. And I think it's not memories at all. It's just a dream you keep having over and over.

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: But it ends up the same.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: One day it will be different. It just takes time. (beat) We'll make new memories. You and me. Silence. She strokes his face. He gives in to her tenderness. He's fading. Two waifs in the dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOURNE running in the sun. A punishing pace along the sand. Moving strong. Effortless. Deep into it. Focused. The stunning conjunction of sun and scenery are lost on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A busy market town. Fishing town. Hippie town. Lots of young Western faces. Rundown and happening at the same time. MARIE shopping. Filling a bag with local produce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOURNE still running, leaving the beach behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARIE back from the market, putting the groceries away. Almost done, when she stops for a moment -- A PHOTOGRAPH. There on the windowsill. A snapshot. Jason and Marie on a beach. Her arms around him. As if she were the protector. Big smiles. Young. Alive. In love. MARIE smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funky busy. Colonial facades in vivid, sub-continental technicolor. Loud morning traffic.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERA FINDS
dialogues.text: BOURNE coming out of a store with a big bottle of water. He's just finished his run. Standing there, chugging away checking the scene, when something catches his eye --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE STREET. A SILVER CAR -- something newish -- pulling down the block -- can't quite see who's driving, but --

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO
dialogues.text: BOURNE watching this silver car. So serious he's casual. Nobody passing would notice, but we do: He's on alert.

dialogues.speaker: HIM AS
dialogues.text: BOURNE follows THE SILVER CAR on foot -- natural -- cruising the BUSY SIDEWALK -- blending into the mix -- chugging on that water bottle and --

dialogues.speaker: UP_AHEAD
dialogues.text: THE SILVER CAR making the corner and turning now --

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO
dialogues.text: BOURNE slowing as he reaches the corner --  10 11 12

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE SILVER CAR has parked. There's a GUY -- well-dressed casual -- physical -- sunglasses -- call him KIRILL -- he out of the car and heading across the street toward a building there. A TELEGRAPH OFFICE.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO
dialogues.text: BOURNE checking his watch. The car. The guy. Perimeter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR. MOHAN at his desk. He's a crisp, proper man of fifty. He's just been handed something -- A PHOTOGRAPH OF MARIE -- an old passport picture.

dialogues.speaker: MR. MOHAN
dialogues.text: And your question, sir? KIRILL across the desk.

dialogues.speaker: KIRILL
dialogues.text: She's my sister. There's been a death in the family. This is the last place we know she called from.

dialogues.speaker: A NOTE ON THE TABLE
dialogues.text: BOURNE has just come in -- just read the note -- balling quickly. In fact, everything is quickly now, because -- BOURNE is bailing. Fast. Calm. Methodical. Some exfil procedure that he's honed and choreographed. Packing like a machine --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- BACKPACKS thrown open on the bed. -- HOUSE CASH pulled from a lamp base. -- CREDIT CARDS taped under the counter

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KIRILL coming out of the bank. Mission accomplished. Heading back to the SILVER CAR. Getting in and --  13 14 15 Al6 16 17 18

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KIRILL starting it up. Glancing around nice and easy. He's cool. Putting the car into gear, he makes a slow pas through the marketplace. Eyes everywhere. *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOURNE -- done -- the place is stripped -- pulling on the backpacks -- glancing around -- one last thing -- shit, h almost missed it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE PHOTOGRAPH -- the one of he and Marie on the beach -- the one we saw her looking at earlier -- there it is on t windowsill -- jamming it into his pocket and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KIRILL now parked and out of the car -- on the move -- on foot -- he begins a sweep of the beach. *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOURNE out the back -- jogging -- keeping low -- into the neighborhood -- through the alleys -- nothing random abou it, this has all been worked out and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crowded with tourists -- sunbathers -- MARIE at her favorite spot. Talking with TWO WOMEN, laughing with them - happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A burly JEEP comes roaring up. BOURNE spots the SILVER * CAR, parks at the other end -- takes off towards the beac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KIRILL methodically making his way up the beach -- checking every blue tent -- every towel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOURNE coming up the beach the opposite way -- one eye on KIRILL, one eye on MARIE. He arrives just as KIRILL looks up and sees them a hundred yards away -- a hard stare between them -- BOURNE bends down --

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: We gotta go, Marie. We gotta go, now. From the tone of his voice, she knows it's serious. Marie grabs her bag. A quick goodbye to the friends. They hurry off. BOURNE uses the sunbathers as cover. KIRILL retreats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They reach the JEEP -- she knows the drill -- bag tossed the back -- even as the Jeep pulls away and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOURNE driving. MARIE beside him --

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: We're blown. She hesitates. One minute ago everything was fine.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: No... How?

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: The Telegraph office.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: But we were so careful.

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: We pushed it. We got lazy. ee eK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KIRILL already back at the SILVER CAR -- following them out onto the MAIN STREET -- blocked by the local traffic pulling a HUGE AUTOMATIC PISTOL out from his travel bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE JEEP pulling down this narrow little passageway and -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAIN STREET packed with traffic and --

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO
dialogues.text: BOURNE not liking this. Eyes all over -- trying to decide

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: But you're sure?

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: He was at the campground yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: So...

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: It's wrong. Guy with a rental car and hundred dollar sneakers sleeps in a tent? Trying to decide whether to pull out or back up --

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: That's crazy.

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: No. Not this. This is real. (suddenly) And he's right there... (throwing the car into reverse)

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Where --

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: Back there -- at the corner -- Hyundai -- silver --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KIRILL trapped in some Main Street gridlock. Glancing bac for a way out -- freezing suddenly, because there -- HIS POV -- THE JEEP -- THE ALLEY -- right there -- twenty yards back -- a good look at BOURNE and MARIE -- as they disappear and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE JEEP backing up the way it came -- BLOWING ITS HORN because an OLD VAN pulls in and blocks him from behind --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOURNE leaning on THE HORN -- shit, now they've got to wait!

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: ...-but you're not -- you're not sure...

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: We can't wait to be sure.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: I don't want to move again...I like it here.

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: Look, we clear out, we get to the shack, we get safe. We hang there awhile. I'11 come back. I'll check it out. But right now we can't --

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: -- where's left to go? --

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: -- there's places -- we can't afford to be wrong!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KIRILL. Calm. Possessed of a familiar tactical patience. He can't get the Hyundai to the alley from where he is an it doesn't make sense to go on foot. He checks his rearview.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He Fe HK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 29 30 10. Fuck it -- there's an opening ahead and he's taking it -- even though it's away from them -- he'll find another way

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOURNE sees the HYUNDAI move forward into traffic. THE OL VAN is still blocking them from behind --

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: You drive.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: (already squeezing over) Switch! You drive!

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: -- where? --

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: -- make the left -- toward the bridge -- MARIE scrambling over the seat. BOURNE, eyes everywhere, checks his watch. THE JEEP squirts back on the main street and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARIE at the wheel -- adrenaline pumping -- clear running for thirty yards ahead and -- MARIE skidding them into the right turn -- clipping anoth vehicle -- MIRROR SHATTERING! -- speeding up. BOURNE scanning behind them -- MARIE moving out to pass - veering back! -- an ONCOMING BUS -- just in time and --

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: -- Jesus! -- (glancing over) -- is he back there? --

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: -- not yet --

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: -- it's just him? --  31 32 11.

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: -- yeah -- one guy -- I don't think he was ready --

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: -- hang on -- MARIE bearing down -- pulling out -- gives him a quick smile -- BOURNE knowing he's got a good one here --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KIRILL stopping short on a rise. Bit of a view from here. Gets half out the car to look. BELOW -- the JEEP headed for A BRIDGE. He's gonna lose them. KIRILL'S mind racing. Grabs duffle from the back, abandons car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARIE driving. BOURNE preps his pistol. Eye out for KIRILL.

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: You keep going to the shack. I'11 meet you there in an hour.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: (concerned) Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: I'm going to bail on the other side and wait. This bridge is the only way he can follow.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: What if it's not who you think it is?

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: If he crosses the bridge, it is.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: There must be another way!

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: I warned them, Marie. I told them to leave us alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ee eK

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Jason, please don't do this...it won't ever be over like this.

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: There's no choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old CONCRETE BRIDGE ahead. Almost there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KIRILL slams into it. Quick, precise grabs into the bag. Only a moment and he's got a SNIPER RIFLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOURNE -- pistol in hand -- spare clip in the other -- checks his watch.

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: At the end make the left, when I roll out do_not slow down. MARIE nods, got it. After a beat...

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: I love you, too.

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: Tell me later. MARIE looks ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KIRILL. Eye to the scope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There! The JEEP rumbling across the bridge. No clear target, just the back of the full DRIVER'S SIDE HEADREST.

dialogues.speaker: KIRILL'S FINGER
dialogues.text: Squeezing. Firing.  34 35 36 37 38 39 13.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The JEEP jerking. FRONT FENDER tearing into and along the guard rail -- cement shards fill the air -- BOURNE reaching for the wheel -- Too late! As the JEEP finally crashes through the flimsy guardrail Plummets -- splashes hard -- begins to sink out of sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KIRILL lowers the scope, takes a quick look around. He's basically gone unnoticed in this little nook with his silenced rifle. But people are already rushing toward the bridge. Then... there! An OLD WOMAN looking directly at KIRILL from a doorway. Not quite sure what. But an old Indian woman in Goa? So what. KIRILL drills her with a look. As she sinks back inside -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swallowed up. BOURNE and MARIE gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KIRILL scans the surface of the river under the bridge. Waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mud plumes as the JEEP settles. BOURNE reaches over to MARIE, tries to urge her out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KIRILL with a killer's patience, waiting, almost done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The surface of the water. Unbroken.  40 41 42 43-68 69 14.

dialogues.speaker: KIRILL
dialogues.text: Scans his perimeter. There's the old woman again. But more people with her. People coming out of the woodwork. KIRILL checks the surface one last time. Nothing. He breaks down the rifle in moments -- goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOURNE -- up into an air pocket held by the jeep's canvas top. A big gulp of air -- And he's back to MARIE. Frantic. Trying to unclip her seatbelt. Pull her out. But it's all jammed up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bag chucked in the back. All he has left is the scope. One last look to the unbroken surface. Then it's time to go. KIRILL -- drifting away -- disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The red halo growing bigger. BLOOD. BOURNE pauses. MARIE'S face is blank. She's dead. BOURNE finally pulling back. Realizing this is goodbye...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We pick up a MAN WITH A BRIEFCASE on a telephoto lens.

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY/RADIO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The seller has arrived.

dialogues.speaker: BERLIN
dialogues.text: 70 71 72 73 15. As the man comes to a CHINESE RESTAURANT he stops. Squarely. So he can be seen clearly. Then he enters a STARK GLASS OFFICE BUILDING.

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY/RADIO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (cont'd) (CONT'D) He's inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO MEN cross the square to the Chinese Restaurant. VIC i forty -- steel-ass intel operator -- he carries A LARGE SAMPLES CASE. Beside him, MIKE, younger, ex-Navy-Seal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "The Hub". Secure, anonymous office space somewhere in th city. Shades drawn. Lots of gear cabled around. The stale, improvised feel of a temporary outpost. Four serious people alone in this room: PAMELA LANDY is 46. A Senior C.I.A. Counterintelligence Officer. Hovering over the communications console. CRONIN -- Pamela's #2 -- early forties, stone-cold facade quarterbacking the operation over the radio -- KURT and KIM are the techs here. His and Her headphones. Ruggedized laptops and comm gear spread around them.

dialogues.speaker: CRONIN
dialogues.text: What have you got, Survey One?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark. TEDDY at the window. Another military face. Radio rig. Night Scope. Watching VIC and MIKE pass below him --

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY/RADIO, (OVER)
dialogues.text: "Hub, this is Survey One. Mobile One is in motion. Seller is inside and waiting."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIC and MIKE slow as they come to the same STARK, GLASS OFFICE BUILDING.

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY/RADIO, (OVER)
dialogues.text: "We are ready to go."  74 75 76 16.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIKE and VIC shake hands; two tired co-workers parting ways. MIKE will keep walking. VIC entering the building through the big glass doors, smiling as he's approached b A NIGHT SHIFT SECURITY GUARD. And we hear: MIKE still walking, alone now, heading away from THE GLAS OFFICE BUILDING toward A VAN parked up the block.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE/RADIO
dialogues.text: (sleeve mike, earpiece) "This is Escort One. I'm clear."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE COMMAND POST. CRONIN works the communications board...

dialogues.speaker: CRONIN
dialogues.text: "All teams -- listen up -- we are standing- by for final green." (turning now to--) PAMELA, who has been listening. Just as she's about to gi the final word, KIM raises a finger...

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Langley... She hands PAMELA a phone that's patched into her board.

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: (a bit surprised) Martin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THREE MEN -- CIA MANDARINS -- sit around a round table. MARTIN MARSHALL, Deputy Vice-Director, he's in charge. All is tense.

dialogues.speaker: MARSHALL
dialogues.text: I'm here. So is Donnie and Jack Weller. We understand you're using the full allocation for this buy?

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: That's where we came out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He HF

dialogues.speaker: MARSHALL
dialogues.text: It's a lot of money, Pam.

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: We're talking raw, unprocessed KGB files. It's not something we can go out and comparison shop.

dialogues.speaker: MARSHALL
dialogues.text: Still...

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: For a thief. A mole. I vetted the source, Marty. He's real. If it does nothing more than narrow the list of suspects, it's a bargain at ten times the price.

dialogues.speaker: MANDARIN
dialogues.text: Pamela, Jack Weller here. It's the quality that's at issue...

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. I'm in total agreement. If they're fakes, they're expensive. (furious, impatient) Gentlemen, I've got the seller on site and in play. Quite honestly, there's not much more to talk about. MARSHALL looks to his MANDARIANS. Not convinced, but doesn't want to lose the opportunity. Time to wash his hands.

dialogues.speaker: MARSHALL
dialogues.text: All right Pam, your game, your call...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All eyes on PAMELA as she puts down the phone to Langley. Nodding to CRONIN. Yes.

dialogues.speaker: CRONIN/RADIO
dialogues.text: "Final Green. You are go. Repeat, you are go for Final Green."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ce

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He He HK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIC has just passed muster with The Security Guard, he's standing alone at AN ELEVATOR BANK.

dialogues.speaker: VIC/RADIO
dialogues.text: (sleeve mike, earpiece) "On my way up." VIC pulling his earpiece. Going dark. Waits for an elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark. A small room full of wiring and infrastructure, lit by the glare of someone's MAG-LIGHT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLOVED HANDS quickly pass over racks of gear and wiring a then stopping at -- the main electrical risers. They carefully place an EXPLOSIVE DEVICE -- no bigger tha a pack of cigarettes -- onto the main riser... Done with that, here comes A SECOND SMALL EXPLOSIVE DEVIC - but this one's special, it's being taken from A PLASTIC BAG and mounted down by the floor on a sub-panel Done, the hands hold up what looks like a piece of tape. It bears a FINGERPRINT. As the tape is pressed down, transferring it onto the charge --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIC alone with THE SAMPLES CASE. Pressing the button for #9, the top floor. The doors close. The car rises...2...3...4...5...6... And then, it stops. VIC bracing himself, as the door opens and -- IVAN -- Russian -- the guy we saw outside with the briefcase -- standing in an empty, darkened hallway.

dialogues.speaker: IVAN
dialogues.text: Show me. vICc Here?

dialogues.speaker: IVAN
dialogues.text: (holding open the door) Now. Show now.  81 82 19. VIC flips open the case. CASH. Three million dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GLASS DOOR. A suite of offices beyond. Clean. Anonymous. One light on deep inside...

dialogues.speaker: CASPIEX-PETROLEUM
dialogues.text: Cherbourg -- Moscow -- Rome -- Tehran

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curtains drawn. Lights low. IVAN sitting with THE SAMPLES CASE, counting the cash. VIC poring over -- RUSSIAN DOCUMENT FILES. Dozens of KGB files. Old and new. Spread sheets, financial data. Incomprehensibly Cyrillic. Marked up. But judging by the seals and clearance sign- offs, all top-secret. vICc This is everything?

dialogues.speaker: IVAN
dialogues.text: Is there. Is all there. Suddenly -- MUSIC -- a radio -- some tinny pop tune just started playing from somewhere down the hall -- vICc -- what the hell is that? -- alone -- you said alone -- Both of them sure they're being double-crossed -- VIC (CONT'D) (cont'd) (reaching for his ankle) -- who? -- who else is here? --

dialogues.speaker: IVAN
dialogues.text: -- no! -- not me! -- no other people! -- vICc (coming up with a pistol) -- shut up! -- just shut the -- Freaked by the gun, IVAN to his feet -- VIC pushing him back as he rushes past -- THE SAMPLE CASE spilling cash a ee eK  83 84 85 20. Wrong. SNAPPH! -- SNAPPH! -- SNAPPH! -- SNAPPH! -- SNAPPH! -- fi fast, suppressed small caliber shots -- VIC falls first - IVAN crashing back across a desk as the bullets tear into him -- both of them dead before they hit the floor and --

dialogues.speaker: REVERSE TO FIND
dialogues.text: The GLOVED HANDS unscrewing a SILENCER, tucking away the weapon. Already in motion before we know what's happened pulling a climbing duffel out from his back pack -- stuffing in THE SAMPLES CASE and IVAN'S BRIEFCASE -- all the files -- all the money... Except, wait... He's left out ONE old KGB FILE COVER -- a now he pulls A PLASTIC BAG from his backpack -- GLOVED HANDS carefully remove A SINGLE SHEET OF PAPER from insid the bag. And this paper looks exactly like all the stuff he's just tucked away; another page full of Cyrillic blur He's putting this sheet of paper inside the file cover. Now he's slipping them both underneath the desk, tossing them there as if they fell in the struggle and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The electrical risers -- as ONE OF THE TWO DETONATION DECIVES BLOWS -- a single, tidy, self-contained explosion and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the lights flicker and fail and THE NIGHT SHIFT SECURITY GUARD is suddenly cast into darkness and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they were. Waiting. But only a moment before --

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY/RADIO
dialogues.text: (sudden, urgent) “Hub? -- we just -- we lost power -- the building! -- the whole place just went dark! --" CRONIN looking at Pamela -- the first whiff of dread as -

dialogues.speaker: CRONIN
dialogues.text: "-- repeat -- who is dark? building or your location? the target

dialogues.text: Anonymous drone barn. KIRILL stepping out of a car. He's carrying the duffle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KIRILL. Heading down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KIRILL enters. It's a small room. GRETKOV is waiting. He's forty. Professional. Trim and polished. Dominant.

dialogues.speaker: GRETKOV
dialogues.text: (Russian) (You're early)

dialogues.speaker: KIRILL
dialogues.text: (You're complaining?)

dialogues.speaker: GRETKOV
dialogues.text: (It's clean?)

dialogues.speaker: KIRILL
dialogues.text: (Would I bring it?) GRETKOV taking over now. Tosses some money on the bed, checks out the photocopy of the files.

dialogues.speaker: GRETKOV
dialogues.text: (What are you doing?) KIRILL stripping quickly --

dialogues.speaker: KIRILL
dialogues.text: (I'm taking a shower, it's been a long day.)

dialogues.speaker: GRETKOV
dialogues.text: (Make it fast, my plane is waiting)
GRETKOV dumping three million dollars over the bed as KIRILL sheds his clothes, and we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WORKMEN cluster as a cable winches -- The JEEP is raised from the river bottom. As water pours off of it -- BOURNE -- Watching -- From a distance -- Empty --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crime scene. POLICE blocking OFFICE WORKERS from getting in the building. MEDIA vans clogging the street. PAMELA and CRONIN, across the street, watching. The mood is black. Ashes.

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: We need to get in there.

dialogues.speaker: CRONIN
dialogues.text: I'm working on it. PAMELA stands there. Silent. Staring at the disaster across the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOURNE is bailing. Exfil procedure, but this is a heartbroken exfil. -- A FOOTLOCKER open. Bourne's main stash. BOURNE going through the footlocker. Setting aside his ‘work clothes' -- other things he needs. But he also has to separate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 93 23. A GROWING PILE of Marie memories: Bank cards. Phony student IDs. Loose passport photos with a mix of looks an hair-dos. Clothes -- vacuum-packed bags -- spare shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gasoline-stoked FIRE burning in a rock-lined pit. BOURN feeding his papers and all of Marie's belongings into the fire. A passport cover crinkles back to reveal her photo. Her face begins to burn. Gas-soaked clothes tossed in. Nothing left except -- The PHOTOGRAPH -- the picture of he and Marie at the beac The one from his desk. BOURNE hesitates, holds the photo out to the flames. The rules of exfil say drop it -- but he can't -- won't -- He reaches to his bag, sticks the photo on top of his gea Then, hefting, the bag, BOURNE strides away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A folding table covered with XEROXED BERLIN POLICE PAPERWORK. PAMELA getting a show-and-tell from CRONIN and TEDDY.

dialogues.speaker: CRONIN
dialogues.text: -- so there were two of these explosive charges placed on the power lines. One of them failed. The fingerprint... (Pamela's got it) That's from the one that didn't go off.

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: And the Germans can't match it?

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: Nobody's got it. We checked every database we could access. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: CRONIN
dialogues.text: Show her the other thing.

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: This is a KGB file that must've fallen somehow and then slipped under, I guess, a desk there, or... (handing it to her--)

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: Do we know what this says?

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: Yup... (a scrap of paper) The main word there, the file heading, translates as: Treadstone.

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: What the hell is a "Treadstone?" CRONIN shaking his head. Nobody knows.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. INDIA COUNTRYSIDE -- DAY c93 BOURNE bouncing around on an old Punjab BUS. Alone ina crush of humanity. Going only God knows where...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAMELA'S POV as she drives toward the entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long, bright, sterile hallway. PAMELA and CRONIN walkin briskly alongside A UNIFORMED S.P.S. OFFICER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAMELA and CRONIN watching THE S.P.S. OFFICER unlock the operation panel. Coding in. They begin to descend and --  99 100-102 103

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drab and desolate. PAMELA and CRONIN come around a corner walking with A NEW ESCORT OFFICER. Passing a sign that reads: Operations Library Center.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sealed, triple-locked NUMBERED DOOR. It swings open. Lights flicker on. Tons of shit packed away in here. Shelves bulging. Boxes. Tapes. Binders. Hard drives. PAMELA steps in. A HUGE FILING CABINET labeled --

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA/PHONE, (OVER)
dialogues.text: Ward?

dialogues.speaker: ABBOTT, (0S)
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA/ PHONE
dialogues.text: Pamela Landy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WARD ABBOTT at his desk. The cluttered clubhouse HQ of a man who's spent the last thirty-five years in the spy gam A PICTURE WINDOW offers a commander's view of the BULLPEN

dialogues.speaker: ABBOTT/PHONE
dialogues.text: What can I do for you, Pam?

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA/ PHONE
dialogues.text: I was hoping you had some time for me.

dialogues.speaker: ABBOTT/PHONE
dialogues.text: Time for what?

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA/ PHONE
dialogues.text: I'm free right now actually.

dialogues.speaker: ABBOTT/PHONE
dialogues.text: That sounds ominous. Let me check my schedule. ABBOTT holds the phone. Eyes drifting out the window and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BULLPEN. CRONIN is standing with DANIEL ZORN, one of Abbott's trusted #2s. Clearly ZORN is getting the less polite version of Pamela's invitation. ZORN managing to shoot a quick, questioning glance to Abbott as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cold room. Desk. Two chairs. ABBOTT and PAMELA alone.

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: Treadstone.

dialogues.speaker: ABBOTT
dialogues.text: Never heard of it.

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: That's not gonna fly.

dialogues.speaker: ABBOTT
dialogues.text: With all due respect, Pam, I think you might've wandered a little past your pay- grade. She has a piece of paper. She slides it forward.

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: That's a warrant from Director Marshall granting me unrestricted access to all personnel and materials associated with Treadstone. ABBOTT rocked and trying to hide it.

dialogues.speaker: ABBOTT
dialogues.text: And what are we looking for?

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: I want to know about Treadstone.

dialogues.speaker: ABBOTT
dialogues.text: To know about it? (almost amused) It was a kill squad. Black on black. Closed down two years ago. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: ABBOTT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Nobody wants to know about Treadstone. Not around here. (the warrant) You better take this back to Marty and make sure he knows what you're doing.

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: (trump card) He does. I've been down to the archives. I have the files, Ward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hard working port. A big MEDITERRANEAN FERRY coming in.

dialogues.speaker: NAPLES
dialogues.text: FERRY -- BOURNE at the rail. Unchanged from India. Staring ahead as Europe looms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOURNE disembarking to an immigration queue. Looking unremarkable. Just one of many passing through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they were. ABBOTT watching PAMELA pull a photo from he file. Sliding it over. CONKLIN'S FACE peering back.

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: Let's talk about Conklin.

dialogues.speaker: ABBOTT
dialogues.text: What are you after, Pam? You want to fry me? You want my desk? Is that it?

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: I want to know what happened.

dialogues.speaker: ABBOTT
dialogues.text: What happened? Jason Bourne happened. (fury focusing) You've got the files? Then let's cut the crap. It went wrong. Conklin had these guys wound so tight they were bound to snap. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: ABBOTT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Bourne was his number one -- guy went out to work, screwed the op and never came back. Conklin couldn't fix it, couldn't find Bourne, couldn't adjust. It all went sideways. Finally there were no options left.

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: So you had Conklin killed. (silence) I mean, if we're cutting the crap...

dialogues.speaker: ABBOTT
dialogues.text: I've given thirty years and two marriages to this agency. I've shoveled shit on four continents. I'm due to retire next year and believe me, I need my pension, but if you think I'm gonna sit here and let you dangle me with this, you can go to hell. Marshall too. (flat) It had to be done.

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: And Bourne? Where's he now?

dialogues.speaker: ABBOTT
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Dead in a ditch? Drunk in a bar in Mogadishu? Who knows?

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: I think I do. We had a deal going down in Berlin last week. During the buy, both our Field Agent and the seller were killed. We pulled a fingerprint from a timing charge that didn't go off. (beat) They were killed by Jason Bourne. ABBOTT hesitates. Blindsided. What? A courtesy knock at the door.

dialogues.speaker: CRONIN
dialogues.text: (appearing in the doorway) They're ready for us upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now at the IMMIGRATION OFFICER booth, BOURNE hands over a OLD BLUE PASSPORT. It reads, JASON BOURNE. What's he up to? Is he giving up?

dialogues.speaker: IMMIGRATION OFFICER
dialogues.text: (Where you coming from, Mr. Bourne? )

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: (Tangiers) The OFFICER runs the CODE on the passport through the SCANNER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TECH turns as a COMPUTER ALARM begins an incessant BEEPING.

dialogues.speaker: THE SCREEN
dialogues.text: As Jason Bourne's PASSPORT DATA begins scrolling through. A sleeper waking up on the grid. Then his PHOTO.

dialogues.speaker: WORK STATION
dialogues.text: As an Interpol SUPERVISOR leans in over the TECH'S should to see what's up. After a beat... As the TECH begins typing and hits send...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CREWCUT turns from his monitor to his own SUPERIOR as, at the same time...

dialogues.text: Looking up from his computer, the IMMIGRATION OFFICER gestures BOURNE to one side.

dialogues.speaker: IMMIGRATION OFFICER
dialogues.text: (Sir, would you be so kind as to step over here, please?)  118 30.

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: (Uh, sure.) The IMMIGRATION OFFICER comes out of his booth as a CARABINIERI joins him and they escort BOURNE to a small room at the side of the CUSTOMS HALL.

dialogues.speaker: IMMIGRATION OFFICER
dialogues.text: (Please wait in here.) BOURNE scans the hall as he walks, enters room...

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA'S, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Seven years ago, twelve million dollars was stolen from a CIA account... BOURNE takes a seat. CARABINIERI guards the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same table. More faces. MARSHALL back in the throne. ABBOTT, THREE C.I.A. MANDARINS plus THEIR #2'S, and --

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: .-.in Warsaw. This is... CLICK -- A PHOTO of the man killed in Berlin fills the projection screen behind her -- CLICK -- crime scene phot of dead body -- CLICK -- "PECOS OIL" logo --

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...Ivan Mevedev -- senior financial Manager -- worked for one of the new Russian petroleum companies, Pecos Oil. He claimed to know where the money landed. We believe this could have only happened with help from someone inside the Agency... This...

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (placing it on the table) ...this is Conklin's computer.

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ..-At the time of his death, Conklin was sitting on a personal account in the amount of seven-hundred and sixty thousand dollars. x % He FH eH HH

dialogues.speaker: ABBOTT
dialogues.text: Do you know what his budget was? *

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: ABBOTT
dialogues.text: We were throwing money at him. Throwing * it at him and asking him to keep it dark. *

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: May I finish? *

dialogues.speaker: ABBOTT
dialogues.text: Conklin might've been a nut, but he wasn't a mole. You have me his calendar for a couple of days, I'll prove he killed Lincoln. (appealing to Marshall) This is supposed to be definitive? ee eK

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: What's definitive, is that I just lost two people in Berlin!

dialogues.speaker: ABBOTT
dialogues.text: So what's your theory? (mocking her) Conklin's reaching out from the grave to protect his good name? (incredulous) The man is dead.

dialogues.speaker: MARSHALL
dialogues.text: (he's heard enough) No one's disputing that, Ward.

dialogues.speaker: ABBOTT
dialogues.text: For crissake, Marty, you knew Conklin. Does this scan? I mean, at all? MARSHALL signals for quiet...

dialogues.speaker: MARSHALL
dialogues.text: Okay, cut to the chase, Pam. What are you selling?

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: I think that Bourne and Conklin were in business. That Bourne is still involved. * (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And that whatever information I was going to buy in Berlin, it was big enough to make Bourne come out from wherever he's been hiding to kill again. (to Abbott) How's that scan? As the MANDARINS all start talking at once -- ZORN enters. Stands at the head of the table. Tries to get their attention.

dialogues.speaker: ZORN
dialogues.text: Hey... (they look up) Look, you're not gonna believe this, but Jason Bourne's passport just came on the grid in Naples. ABBOTT blinks. What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEVINS. American. A junior, C.I.A. Field Officer. Walking from the parking lot, talking on his cellphone.

dialogues.speaker: NEVINS
dialogues.text: ...-what can I do? I can't. I'11 call you when I know what I'm into... (a hassled pause) I don't know, some guy's name came up on the computer. (starting toward the building) So start without me, if I can get there, I will. Later... NEVINS hangs up and pockets the phone. He hustles towards the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is jumping. Agents tracking, working the phones and computers. PAMELA giving orders. ABBOTT watches. He eH HK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ee eK  123 33.

dialogues.speaker: CRONIN
dialogues.text: (looks up from computer screen) Looks like he's been detained. ee eK

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: Who's going? Us?

dialogues.speaker: CRONIN
dialogues.text: There's only a Consulate, they sent a field officer out half an hour ago --

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: (cuts him off) Then get a number, they need to know who they're dealing with. ee eK CRONIN already on it... *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As NEVINS flashes his credentials to CARABINIERI at door, who gives an unimpressed shrug and lets him in. NEVINS takes his overcoat off, tosses it on the empty chair. We see a big ass .45 for just a second under his suit jacket.

dialogues.speaker: NEVINS
dialogues.text: Alright, Mr. Bourne, is that your name? (BOURNE nods) Name's Nevins. I'm with the US Consulate. Could I see your passport? BOURNE, silent, hands over his passport.

dialogues.speaker: NEVINS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So, Mr. Bourne... NEVINS studies Bourne's passport...

dialogues.speaker: NEVINS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are you doing in Tangiers? Silence... *

dialogues.speaker: NEVINS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (faux friendly) Are you travelling alone? *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 123 34. BOURNE stares straight ahead. NEVINS comes around the table and sits in front of BOURNE.

dialogues.speaker: NEVINS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (in his face) Look, I don't know what you've done. But, you're gonna need to play ball here. NEVINS cell starts to ring. He shrugs an apology, turns away and answers: NEVINS (cont'd) (CONT'D) Nevins...

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA/ PHONE
dialogues.text: This is Pamela Landy, a CI Supervisor calling from Langley, Virginia. Are you with a Jason Bourne now?

dialogues.speaker: NEVINS
dialogues.text: (listens; looks at Bourne) Yes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAMELA on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: Then use extreme caution. He can be very unpredictable and violent. Use whatever means necessary to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever Nevins is being told, it's concerning. BOURNE watching him. Knows exactly what this is. CLOSE ON NEVINS as he steps away, listening intently. His hand just starting to move toward his shoulder holster. NEVINS (cont'd) Okay, I'll call you right back. NEVINS flips shut his phone. He reaches for his gun, even as he turns, and -- BOURNE is right there in his face. WHUMP! Momentum and gravity reaching mutual agreement as NEVINS hits the deck CARABINIERI barely clears his holster before -- CHOP -- CHOP -- BOURNE has him down in a heap. + Fe *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ee eK ee eK  124 125 126 127 128-129 130 35. BOURNE is back, silent and effective. Finding NEVINS cellphone, BOURNE reaches into his bag. He holds the phone next to a larger, diagnostic MOBILE UNIT the "confirm" light blinks -- Nevins' phone has been cloned. BOURNE puts the phone back in NEVINS coat, takes his gun and CARABINIERI'S gun and radio and puts them in his duffle. We're starting to realize there's a plan at work here.

dialogues.speaker: FINALLY
dialogues.text: BOURNE -- exits the door, wedging a desk under the handle so it cannot be opened from the inside and calmly walks away like nothing ever happened --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now we see the old BOURNE, in his long black coat, purposely striding out of the building. He pauses long enough for the security camera to get a good look at him. THE RONIN returns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOURNE crosses the street and approaches a man putting hi suitcase in the trunk of a green Peugeot. BOURNE reaches into his bag, pulls out some cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEVINS stirring, the CARABINIERI still out. A phone start to RING. Nevins' phone. Finally sitting up, he answers.

dialogues.speaker: NEVINS
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAMELA at the other end of the line.

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA/ PHONE
dialogues.text: Mr. Nevins?

dialogues.speaker: NEVINS / PHONE
dialogues.text: Who's this?

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA/ PHONE
dialogues.text: Pamela Landy, again. Where do we stand? *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nevins barely knows where he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOURNE sits in the dark car. Headphones. A nest of cool gadgetry -- on the passenger seat. Listening in -- * recording -- He writes: Pamela Landy -- circles it.

dialogues.speaker: NEVINS / PHONE
dialogues.text: I think... I think he got away. * PAMELA looks at the faces waiting around the table. Shake her head no... *

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: Have you locked down the area? *

dialogues.speaker: NEVINS / PHONE
dialogues.text: Ah, we're in Italy. They don't exactly * “lock down" real quick...

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA/ PHONE
dialogues.text: How long have you worked for the agency?

dialogues.speaker: NEVINS / PHONE
dialogues.text: Me? Four years.

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA/ PHONE
dialogues.text: If you ever want to make it to five, you're gonna listen to me real close. Jason Bourne is armed and extremely dangerous. A week ago, he assassinated two men in Berlin, one of whom was a * highly-experienced field officer... * (continuing as--)
We're TOTALLY ON BOURNE at this point -- sitting there in the dark car, struggling to make sense of this -- what th fuck is she talking about? -- Berlin? -- He writes it, circles it.

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA/PHONE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I want that area secured, I want any evidence secured and I want it done now. Is that clear??

dialogues.speaker: NEVINS / PHONE
dialogues.text: Yes, sir -- ma'am...

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA/ PHONE
dialogues.text: I'm getting on a plane to Berlin in 45 minutes, which means you are going to call me back in 30, and when I ask you where we stand, I had better be impressed. My mobile number is... BOURNE already turning the key in the ignition -- THE PEUGEOT ROARING TO LIFE, as he writes the number. Dropping the car into gear, BOURNE pulls briskly away fro the curb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAMELA finishes, hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: ABBOTT
dialogues.text: Berlin!

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: I've already got a team there. I doubt Bourne's in Naples to settle down and raise a family.

dialogues.speaker: ABBOTT
dialogues.text: You don't know what you're getting into here.

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: And you do? From the moment he left Treadstone, he has killed and eluded every person that you sent to find him... Before it can come to blows --

dialogues.speaker: MARSHALL
dialogues.text: (riot act) Enough. I want both of you on that plane. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ee eK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ee eK

dialogues.speaker: MARSHALL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And we are -- all of us -- going to do what we were either too lazy or inept to do the last time around -- you're going to find this sonofabitch and take him down before he destroys any more of this agency. (beat) Is that definitive enough for you? ABBOTT nods. Sharing a look with PAMELA as we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAMELA and CRONIN come screaming around a corner and down a long corridor, ABBOTT and ZORN trying to keep up.

dialogues.speaker: CRONIN
dialogues.text: -- Kurt's reopening all the wyfi and sat links --

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: -- uplink all relevant files to Kim -- (a look back at Zorn) -- and I want them to contact anyone who had anything to do with Treadstone -- ZORN looks to ABBOTT, as they disappear around a corner...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE PEUGEOT speeding North -- North towards Germany and -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOURNE driving -- listening to playback of Pamela's conversation with Nevins.

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA/TAPE
dialogues.text: “Jason Bourne is armed and extremely dangerous..." BOURNE'S FACE -- eyes -- tight -- looking weird --

dialogues.text: He eH HK

dialogues.text: FLASHBACK! -- a shard -- pieces -- lightning flash of images GETTING IN THE BACK SEAT OF THE CAR -- rolling

dialogues.speaker: BRANDENBURG BERLIN
dialogues.text: THE DRIVER looks back. We see him. (We'll know him later as Jarda.) Then -- A STEEL CASE on the backseat. Inside a SYRINGE, A DARK VIAL, PISTOL. As we lay hands on them --

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO
dialogues.text: BOURNE out of it -- jolted! -- almost losing control of t car for a second -- jerking back into his lane, -- recognition -- toughing it out -- Steady as she goes -- Catching his rhythm again. Accelerating and ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BAKERY on the corner. NICKY emerging. Nicky from the old days. Suddenly, she stops -- ABBOTT stands there beside a parked car. The passenger door open. Message clear. Get the fuck in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside a hanger. Inside an office. ABBOTT watching as CRONIN questions NICKY. PAMELA sits on a window sill.

dialogues.speaker: CRONIN
dialogues.text: So your cover at the time was what?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: That I was an American student in Paris.

dialogues.speaker: CRONIN
dialogues.text: What exactly did your job with Treadstone in Paris consist of? Nicky looks to Abbott. He nods that it's okay to answer. Pamela bristles at the check-off.  cop. 40.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: I had two responsibilities. One was to coordinate logistical operations. The other was to monitor the health of the agents, to make sure they were up to date with their medications.

dialogues.speaker: CRONIN
dialogues.text: Health, meaning what?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Their mental health. Because of what they'd been through. They were prone to a variety of problems.

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: (losing patience) * What kind of problems?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Depression. Anger. Compulsive behaviors. They had physical symptoms -- headaches -- sensitivity to light --

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: Amnesia? *

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Before this? Before Bourne? No. NICKY gets agitated. ABBOTT steps in, fatherly, good *

dialogues.speaker: ABBOTT
dialogues.text: Were you familiar with the training program?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: The details? No. I mean, I was told it was voluntary. I don't know if that's true or not, but that's what I was told. (a bit defensive) Look, they took vulnerable subjects, okay? You mix that with the right pharmacology and some serious behavior modification, and, I don't know, I mean, I guess anything's possible. ZORN arrives from outside. *  136 137 41.

dialogues.speaker: ZORN
dialogues.text: The jet's ready. (points to Nicky) There's a car for you. Everybody moving. NICKY relieved. She's off the hook. She thinks. She becomes aware of PAMELA considering her.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Good luck.

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: You were his local contact. You were with him the night Conklin died. You're coming with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Streaks across the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet in the cabin. ABBOTT gets up to use the bathroom. PAMELA sits across from NICKY who stares out the window. As the bathroom door clicks shut, PAMELA seizes the privacy.

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: I'm curious about Bourne. Your interpretation of his condition. You have specific training in the identification and diagnosis of psychological conditions?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Am I a doctor, no, but...

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: Are you an expert in amnesia?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Look, what do you want me to say? I was there. I believed him.

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: Believed what?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: I believed Jason Bourne had suffered a severe traumatic breakdown. ee eK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ee eK ee eK

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: So he fooled you.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: (frustration building) If you say so.

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: (leans in; still low) Not good enough. You're the person who floated this amnesia story. (shifts gears) Ever feel sorry for him? For what he'd been through?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: You're making it out like we're friends here or something. I _met him alone twice.

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: You felt nothing? No spark? Two young people in Paris? Dangerous missions? Life and death?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: (incredulous) You mean, did I want a date?

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: Did you?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: These were killers. Conklin had them all jacked up. They were Dobermans.

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: Some women like Dobermans --

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: What do you want from me? I was reassigned. I'm out.

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: See, that's a problem for me, Nicky. Whatever he's doing, we need to end it. This isn't the kind of mess you walk away from. PAMELA leans away. NICKY looks back out the window. ee eK ee eK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three in the morning as the GULF STREAM lurches to a stop TWO BLACK SEDANS here for the pickup. TEDDY the greeting party as -- PAMELA, CRONIN, ABBOTT, ZORN and NICKY disembark --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SEDANS making their way, stopping at a non-descript office building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELEVATOR opens into their 9th floor world. Emergency activity. KIM ready to debrief, KURT work the computers. Energy up. PAMELA, ABBOTT and CRONIN bring NICKY into the room.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: -- so far Bourne's had no contact with anyone on the list -- Langley pulled an image out of Naples, it's uploading right now.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: Coming in now... Everything stops, as THE PHOTO -- blurry, oblique -- begi materializing on HALF-A-DOZEN MONITORS around the room. Suddenly, they're surrounded by Bourne.

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: (to Nicky) Is it him? Looking closer -- she nods...

dialogues.speaker: CRONIN
dialogues.text: He's not hiding, that's for sure.

dialogues.speaker: ZORN
dialogues.text: Why Naples? Why now? PAMELA has gone quiet, just staring at the picture, as --

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: Could be random.

dialogues.speaker: CRONIN
dialogues.text: Maybe he's running. ABBOTT looks skeptical.

dialogues.speaker: ABBOTT
dialogues.text: On his own passport?

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: (the image) What's he actually doing?

dialogues.speaker: CRONIN
dialogues.text: What's he doing? He's making his first mistake... And then, from behind them --

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: It's not a mistake. (everyone looks over) They don't make mistakes. And they don't do random. There's always an objective, always a target. (beat) If he's in Naples, on his own passport, there's a reason. PAMELA turns to ABBOTT. A silent moment between them. They're in it now and they know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE PEUGEOT streaking through the Alps. Passing a sign fo the German border. Moonlit glacial peaks whipping past as CLUB MUSIC STARTS PULSING LOUDER AND LOUDER and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOURNE driving hard. Pushing the car through the night. Mission Bourne. As the MUSIC KEEPS JUST BUILDING AND BUILDING, taking us into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Packed and loud. Skin and smoke. A DOORMAN on the move, taking us with him through THE CROWD. Faces -- voices -- all the Moscow party people and --

dialogues.speaker: AT THE BACK
dialogues.text: ee eK  140 141 142 143 45. A VIP BOOTH. KIRILL simply shitfaced. But in a really creepy, numb kind of way. THREE WOMEN, absolutely gorgeous, are sitting around him, chatting away as if he weren't even there. The girls looking up to see --

dialogues.speaker: THE DOORMAN
dialogues.text: (standing there) (Can he walk?) KIRILL stirs. His stupor a futile attempt to escape. Eyes still those of an exceptionally hard man. A minute later. KIRILL can walk. The most graceful drunk you've ever seen. Making his way through the club. Tuning out everything but the need to get to THE DOOR and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, day. It's nine a.m. KIRILL suddenly in the sunlight. People going to work. Kids off to school and -- GRETKOV sitting in his Mercedes, not happy. FOLLOW CAR and SECURITY and ASSISTANT equally unhappy.

dialogues.speaker: GRETKOV
dialogues.text: (You told me Jason Bourne was dead.) KIRILL blinking against the sunlight -- trying to process

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Discreet and chilly. A car pulls up. A MAN gets out.

dialogues.speaker: MUNICH
dialogues.text: We don't see his face as he heads in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man enters. His alarm system -- beep...beep -- starts once he comes through the door. There's A KEYPAD on the wall. He enters his code and the beeping stops. Just like everyday. It's a sad house. He hangs his coat on the rack. Moving now --  46.

dialogues.speaker: INTO
dialogues.text: THE KITCHEN. He drops his briefcase on the table, opens the fridge for a drink. Except what he comes out with is

dialogues.speaker: A GUN
dialogues.text: Wheeling around. The salaryman is JARDA. JARDA from Bourne's dream. But as he turns -- BOURNE behind him. Bigger gun. Waiting. So ready.

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: I emptied it.

dialogues.speaker: JARDA
dialogues.text: (a total pro) Felt a little light.

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: Drop it. JARDA lets the gun fall, looks his old comrade over a bea But Bourne's not interested in a reunion. BOURNE (cont'd) (CONT'D) Here... Bourne tosses him FLEXCUFFS -- JARDA puts his hands behin his back, turns to let BOURNE cinch them. BOURNE (cont'd) (CONT'D) Front. Use your teeth.

dialogues.speaker: JARDA
dialogues.text: (caught scamming) Sorry. Old habits. BOURNE kicks over a chair. Sit.

dialogues.speaker: JARDA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Word in the ether was you'd lost your memory. BOURNE checking JARDA'S briefcase -- tearing through it -

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: You still should've moved.

dialogues.speaker: JARDA
dialogues.text: I like it here. (a beat) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: JARDA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Last time I saw you was Greece. You had a good spot. BOURNE reacts -- doesn't look over -- but realizes...

dialogues.speaker: JARDA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I had the girl. I had her lined up that whole afternoon. Waiting for you, that was the problem. (defensive) You ever do two targets? It's tough. BOURNE turns. Cold.

dialogues.speaker: JARDA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (his real question) So why didn't you kill me then?

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: She wouldn't let me. (beat) She's the only reason you're alive. Silence. JARDA down a peg. Or two.

dialogues.speaker: JARDA
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: Conklin.

dialogues.speaker: JARDA
dialogues.text: He's dead. BOURNE -- the gun -- right to Jarda's face --

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: Try again.

dialogues.speaker: JARDA
dialogues.text: Shot dead in Paris. Dead the night you walked out.

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE / PHONE
dialogues.text: Then who runs Treadstone?

dialogues.speaker: JARDA
dialogues.text: Nobody. They shut it down. We're the last two. It's over... (not finishing because--) -- he's falling! -- landing hard -- BOURNE just kicked th chair out from under him --  48.

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: You're lying. If it's over, why are they after me?

dialogues.speaker: JARDA
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: Who sent you to Greece?

dialogues.speaker: JARDA
dialogues.text: A voice. A voice from the States. Someone new.

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: Pamela Landy?

dialogues.speaker: JARDA
dialogues.text: I don't know who that is.

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: What's going on in Berlin?

dialogues.speaker: JARDA
dialogues.text: I don't know! Why would I lie? Silence. BOURNE pulls back. Unsure. JARDA makes it to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: JARDA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What the hell did you do? You must have really screwed up. BOURNE doesn't know. He backs off.

dialogues.speaker: JARDA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She really did that? Told you not to kill me? (beat) I had a woman once. But after a while, what do you talk about? I mean, for us. The work. You can't tell them who you are...

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: I did. JARDA hesitates. It's really like Bourne just told him ho much he loved her.

dialogues.speaker: JARDA
dialogues.text: I thought you were here to kill me.  144 49. Something in the way he said it. Plus Jarda just glanced at his watch.

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: What did you do? JARDA shrugs, almost embarrassed. BOURNE looks across to the alarm pad Jarda hit on the way in. Voltage -- like a switch. BOURNE (cont'd) (CONT'D) You called it in?

dialogues.speaker: JARDA
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: How long? How long do I have -- (stopping because--) THE PHONE JUST STARTED RINGING -- loud -- insistent -- BOURNE (cont'd) (CONT'D) How_long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamming -- right the fuck into it -- three guys -- JARHEA -- DOD Special Force dudes -- speeding through MUNICH -- JAR #1 is the driver -- JAR #2 is prepping weapons like a maniac in the backseat and --

dialogues.speaker: JAR
dialogues.text: (on the phone) -- it's a red flag file! -- so fix it, call them back ASAP! --

dialogues.speaker: JAR
dialogues.text: (the call) What? What'd they do?

dialogues.speaker: JAR
dialogues.text: (bad news) She called Munich local.

dialogues.speaker: JAR
dialogues.text: (slamming home another clip) It's probably just a drill anyway.  50.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PHONE RINGING -- JARDA in cuffs -- BOURNE scanning out th windows -- everything fast --

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: -- car keys?

dialogues.speaker: JARDA
dialogues.text: -- my coat -- but we should --

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: -- what? --

dialogues.speaker: JARDA
dialogues.text: -- take the back -- get another car -- BOURNE hesitates -- just a moment -- Wrong. SLAM! -- out of nowhere -- JARDA swings -- two-hands -- still cuffed -- like a mace -- catching BOURNE hard and - BOURNE stunned -- JARDA smashing the coffee table, slices the flexcuffs through on a shard of glass -- Free! JARDA follows up -- knee up in the ribs -- THE GUN KNOCKE FREE FROM BOURNE'S HAND! -- skittering across the floor - BOURNE -- as JARDA starts to move -- backhanding him and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO MUNICH PATROL CARS rolling and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seen from inside, glimpsed through the glass outside. It's war -- a flat-out, close-quarter death match -- JARD older and cuffed, but strong and determined -- BOURNE sti hammered from that opening sucker-punch -- the two of the braced there -- grappling -- falling -- JARDA -- the cuffs -- he's got BOURNE in a choke-hold -- but BOURNE driving his head back -- into JARDA'S FACE and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamming along through Munich --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JARDA -- BOURNE -- THE GUN on the floor -- struggling for it -- JARDA there first -- BOURNE on him -- pinned there four hands, one gun and -- BLAMM!!! -- wild shot -- into the refrigerator -- Still wrestling -- breaking JARDA's nose, until -- The gun knocked away again. Finally their hands locked into each other's throats. Thi is as real and up close as it gets. Until, BOURNE finally holds dead weight. Eyes fixed. Staring... BOURNE jumping back. Blood all over his shirt -- BOURNE'S first kill in a long time. A messy one -- Revulsion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JARHEADS getting close -- but up ahead -- ANOTHER MUNICH PATROL CAR in motion -- the JARHEADS react -- don't need or want the company.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOURNE -- all business now -- pulling THE STOVE away from the wall -- there -- THE GAS LINE HOSE -- BOURNE ripping free -- gas running wide open into the room --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next -- A FORK -- grabbing it -- jamming it down into the mechanism on a TOASTER -- wedging it there -- and now he' grabbing PAPERS -- JARDA's stuff on the table -- jamming roll of sales projections into the toaster beside the for BOURNE coughing from the gas, turning the toaster on. Checking his watch. Taking one last look at JARDA dead on the floor and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're just turning into the street --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE DOD CAR -- THREE DODS approaching the house, when -- BOOOOOMM!!! -- JARDA'S KITCHEN -- blown out! -- gone --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOURNE -- same moment -- flying out the rear -- as planne -- urban backyard exfil -- he's flying and -- Gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire -- smoke -- it's all burning now -- MUNICH COPS blow back -- they'll have a story to tell tonight --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drives away past arriving police...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bullpen is cranking -- phones to Munich -- lines to Langley -- ABBOTT watching from the sidelines -- KURT and KIM at their work stations -- PAMELA on mobile, turns to

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: So he beats a man within an inch of his life, strangles him, then blows the place up? (at Nicky) For someone with amnesia, he certainly hasn't forgotten how to kill, has he? Across the room -- CRONIN and TEDDY suddenly excited abou what they're seeing on THEIR SCREEN --

dialogues.speaker: CRONIN
dialogues.text: -- hey! -- they've got him boxed in! -- (new data coming up on the monitor) Everyone rushing to look. Excited, except --

dialogues.speaker: ZORN
dialogues.text: Forget it. They lost him.

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: What're you talking about? They've got a three block perimeter.

dialogues.speaker: ZORN
dialogues.text: You can't see him? He's not in front of you? Forget it. He's gone.

dialogues.speaker: CRONIN
dialogues.text: (fuck you, buzzkill) * It's not gonna be like last time. *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better start listening to someone. Cause we've been there.

dialogues.speaker: ABBOTT
dialogues.text: Okay, enough... (stepping in) Take a walk, Danny. Get some air. ee eK Zorn nods. Happy to. *

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: (piping in) I don't think we need to keep looking for him anyway.

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: And why is that?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Because he's doing just what he said he'd * do. He's coming for us. And for the first time they're all thinking the same thin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is pouring rain. Seen from that Hellish car, A HUGE, DISTINCTIVE, NEEDLE-LIKE TOWER dominates the skyline, lights flashing through the dark and wet --  166 167

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOURNE'S EYES OPENING! -- heart pounding -- springing up alone -- damn, his side hurts -- recoiling from that -- where is he? -- he's in the car -- looking around and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AN AUTOBAHN REST-STOP. Gas station. Sleeping trucks.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO
dialogues.text: BOURNE catching his breath -- shifting away from the pain in his rib -- checking his watch -- but what the hell is that on his sleeve? -- fuck, it's BLOOD -- JARDA's blood

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOURNE out of the car fast -- careless -- wrong -- not ev checking who's watching -- pulling off the shirt -- teari it off -- throwing it down and -- Standing there. In the weird light. A big bruise ripening on his side. Looking around. It's okay. Nobody's watching. But, shit, man... Get it together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Streaking along. BOURNE back to his mission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roaring by a SIGN: Berlin 75 KM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KIRILL striding through the terminal. Moving quickly toward a departure gate and --

dialogues.speaker: THE CAMERA FINDS
dialogues.text: GRETKOV above. Watching him go.  169 170-178 179

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOURNE drives up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet and forlorn this early. Just like BOURNE who's taking A LOCKER. Stashing A BACKPACK. Prepping the evac. Always ready. He heads outside, we hear:

dialogues.speaker: HOTEL OPERATOR
dialogues.text: (front desk German) (Berlin Hilton, how can I help you?)

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE/PHONE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (I'm trying to reach a guest, Pamela Landy, please.)

dialogues.speaker: HOTEL OPERATOR
dialogues.text: (I'm sorry but I'm not showing that we have a guest by that name.) (continuing as--)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOURNE tucked in with a BERLIN GUIDE BOOK, a felt tip pen and a Fifty-Euro phonecard. Working it.

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE / PHONE
dialogues.text: (Pamela Landy, please)

dialogues.speaker: HOTEL OPERATOR
dialogues.text: (Sorry, I don't see it here.) Crossing out another Hotel off the list -- four down, for to go -- as we start TIME CUTTING and...

dialogues.speaker: HOTEL VOICES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (overlapping) (-- no one here by that name --) (-- no, sir, there's no Landy here --) (-- how are you spelling that, sir? --) (-- sorry, but no --) (-- I have no Landy registered, sir --) (continuing, until--)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clean and plain. A bed nobody's slept in. THE PHONE begins ringing. PAMELA, fresh from the shower, rushing ou from the bathroom to answer it --

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA/ PHONE
dialogues.text: Hello -- Dial tone. PAMELA hangs up. That was strange -- EXT. BERLIN STREETS/ALEXANDERPLATZ -- DAWN c179 A TAXI driving through the empty early streets and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOURNE in the backseat. Staring out the window and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE FERNSEHTURM looming as they pass, the Berlin TV Tower That needle in the sky. From the flashback. And then --

dialogues.speaker: SUDDENLY E179
dialogues.text: FLASHBACK! -- it's raining -- we're still moving -- still in a car -- still near Alexanderplatz, but suddenly it's pouring outside -- turning back, we realize we're not in the cab anymore -- there's A DRIVER up front, and beside him... CONKLIN! -- yes, Conklin -- he's in the passenger seat -- turning back to us -- handing us something -- A PHOTOGRAP a face -- some guy --

dialogues.speaker: CONKLIN
dialogues.text: Neski. Vladimir Neski... (the photo) He's at the Hotel Brecker. Get the Papers. (beat) Say it. BOURNE -- Treadstone Bourne -- alone in the back -- stari at the photo --

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: Neski. Hotel Brecker. Papers.

dialogues.speaker: CONKLIN
dialogues.text: This is not a drill, soldier. We're clear on that? This is a live project and you are go. Training is over.

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: CONKLIN
dialogues.text: Good, then gimme the damn picture back. (taking it) See you on the other side. (to the driver) Pull over, he's getting out.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO F179
dialogues.text: BOURNE sitting in the back seat of the cab. Frozen there. Rocked. What's happening to him? No chance to work it out, because the taxi's stopped and --

dialogues.speaker: TAXI DRIVER
dialogues.text: (waiting; irritated) (The Hotel Brecker or the Grand?, make up your mind.)

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: (What?)

dialogues.speaker: TAXI DRIVER
dialogues.text: (This is the Westin Grand. You just said Brecker.)

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: (fishing for money) (Yeah. Sorry. This is good.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Concentric rings looking down on each other. BOURNE slipping in unnoticed, taking a quick look up before moving along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOURNE stepping up to the GUY behind the desk. The gym mostly empty.

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: Hi. I think I left my backpack here yesterday. Black, Nike.

The guy disappears in back to check. BOURNE leans across the counter, scrolling the COMPUTER - the guest list -- his finger stabbing down on... SCREEN: Landy, Pamela 413. BOURNE clears the screen, walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because of the set-up, Bourne, pretending to talk on a house phone, has a view of ROOM 413 across the way. The door opens, PAMELA exits, carrying an overnight bag -- BOURNE watches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELEVATOR DOORS OPENING. PAMELA coming out into the lobby. Heading toward the exit and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BLACK SUBURBAN at the curb. CRONIN standing there waiting, as she emerges --

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: Anything?

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: No. Munich's a bust. He's loose.

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: Are we locked up?

dialogues.speaker: CRONIN
dialogues.text: I told everyone they had an hour -- eat, sleep, shave, whatever they want, but once we're back, we're back for good. As they pile in, and --

dialogues.speaker: THE CAMERA FINDS
dialogues.text: BOURNE walking right past them -- he's got the whole thin scoped -- heading quickly across the street and -- He HF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOURNE jumps into the first cab in the rank and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE DRIVER starting up the car, as --

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: (That black SUV. Fifty Euros if you keep me close.) THE DRIVER smiles and -- INT. BERLIN AIRPORT HOTEL -~- EARLY MORNING 179I pt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KIRILL walks down the same hallway Gretkov came to meet h last time. A GUY carrying a briefcase toward him. Stopping for a moment to light a smoke. Letting KIRILL take charge of th briefcase. Smooth. Like it never happened --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SUV rolling up. The CAB continuing past and stopping at the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOURNE looking back out the rear window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they pile out of the van, start inside. Acknowledged b a SECURITY DETAIL pretending to loiter outside. As we hear:

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA, (VO)
dialogues.text: -- Munich to Berlin, check everything -- flights -- trains -- police reports -- that'll be Box #1, Teddy that's yours -- (continuing as--)  1791 pt. 181 182 183 60. INT. BERLIN HOTEL ROOM -- DAY 179I pt. KIRILL opening the briefcase. TWO AUTOMATIC PISTOLS. SILENCERS. AMMO. Care package.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bulkhead opening. BOURNE stepping out among the satellite dishes. Unpacks a bag: telescope, water, food, and we hear:

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA, (VO)
dialogues.text: -- Box #2, call it Prior German Connections -- Nicky, I want to re-run all Bourne's Treadstone material, every footstep -- Kim, Box #3 -- let's call it Munich Outbound -- (continuing as--)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been hearing it, now we're seeing it: PAMELA at the chalkboard -- ABBOTT backing her up -- everyone else spre around -- they're re-grouping -- urgently -- behind them cots are being set up -- food, water stacked up --

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: -- let's stay on the local cops, we need a vehicle -- parking ticket -- something -- Langley's offered to upload any satellite imaging we need, so let's find a target to look for. (to Zorn) Danny, Box #4 -- I need fresh eyes -- review the buy where we lost the three million -- timeline it with what we know about Bourne's movements. Turn it upside down and see how it looks -- (continuing as--)
