NESKI'S FACE right there -- seeing him so freaked she can't even register it yet -- BOURNE with the pistol in her face -- finger to his lips "shhh..." -- but she knows -- backing away -- begging for her life in Russian -- this awful blur of desperation and fear -- MR. NESKI turning back to see his wife backing out of the bathroom and BOURNE with the pistol -- with no hesitation SNAP! -- one shot -- into Neski's heart -- he's down -- MRS. NESKI -- what's just happened? -- BOURNE has her wrist in his hand -- raising it to her hea - to where he holds the pistol -- her fingers -- his trigger -- SNAP! -- letting the gun fall with her as she drops and -- BOURNE starts to move -- starts to prep his evac -- but there's something on the dresser -- A PHOTOGRAPH -- the Neski family -- father, mother and a TWELVE-YEAR-OLD GIRL -- arms around each other -- happy a BOURNE staring at the picture -- undone for a moment --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOURNE -- our Bourne -- standing where they fell. Frozen there. Paralyzed by the shame of original sin. DELETED 212 pt

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SWAT CAPTAIN conferring discreetly with the MANAGER.

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER
dialogues.text: He's in 618.

dialogues.speaker: SWAT CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Call all the guests on the 6th floor. Tell them to remain in their rooms. Tell them it's a police order. Then start on the 5th and 8th floors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOURNE -- trying to stabilize -- to breathe --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SWAT team on their way up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RING! RING! BOURNE snaps back as the phone in his room STARTS TO RING. Four times and it stops. BOURNE freezes. Footsteps. Shadows under the door. He leans into the peephole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROOM #644. GERMAN S.W.A.T. TEAM. Taking position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOURNE backs away -- surveys the room -- his watch -- his balance and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quickly turning into a major event -- HALF-A-DOZEN POLICE VEHICLES already parked here -- MORE ARRIVING every minut - PASSERSBY mixing with the COPS and PEOPLE FROM THE HOTE who've just come out and --

dialogues.speaker: A219
dialogues.text: 220 221 222 223 225 83. KIRILL jogging over from THE BMW he's just parked and --

dialogues.speaker: WHAM
dialogues.text: flooding into BOURNE'S EMPTY HOTEL ROOM and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOURNE -- in motion -- out the bathroom window and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BERLIN SWAT LEADER gives order to search other rooms and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOURNE up the water pipe to the roof -- as he arrives, a SWAT team member turns -- BOURNE pulls him over the edge fires point blank into the 2nd SWAT member's vest -- * stunning him. He's moving fast -- scrambling along the * roof and into the night... *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAM! The door caves in and the SWAT team moves enters # 645 -- rushing to the window -- Nobody -- No sign of him and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KIRILL heading for THE HOTEL ENTRANCE blocked by the * exiting guests. *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too many cops and radios --  226 227 228-229 230 231 234 232 84.

dialogues.speaker: SWAT TEAM BOSS
dialogues.text: (trying to take charge)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAMELA jumping out of A VAN the moment it stops. Seeing it all. The crowd. The army of cops. The searchlights playing across THE HOTEL FACADE. It's another disaster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KIRILL wants to get upstairs -- he can't -- TOO MANY GUES coming down the stairwell -- BERLIN COPS trying keep it moving and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KIRILL hears BOURNE is on the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAMELA and CRONIN listening to TEDDY who just got the police update --

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: Black coat, possibly leather. Dark slacks. Dark t-shirt. (pointing now--) He says they're gonna try and corral the guests on the street over there, and then check them out, but...

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: (disgusted) Yeah, that'll work...What the hell was he doing here?  233 234 244 85.

dialogues.speaker: CRONIN
dialogues.text: Maybe he just needed a place to spend the night?

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: I want to look at the room. * (to TEDDY as she goes) Check it out. *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAMELA'S in charge now. They enter the elevator. *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOURNE coming around the other side of the hotel -- Stepping to the left before he spots the SWAT van -- BOURNE about-faces -- heads the other way -- A SIDEWALK COP looks over, checks the BOURNE PHOTO print- out in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TEDDY huddled with the HOTEL MANAGER and A GROUP OF HIGH- RANKING BERLIN COPS, turning back as --

dialogues.speaker: ABBOTT
dialogues.text: (arriving breathless) They missed him?

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: So far. But they found Nicky. She's back at the Westin. Bourne let her go.

dialogues.speaker: ABBOTT
dialogues.text: He let her go? Great. Where's Danny? He should head over there and debrief her. ee eK (the Hotel) What's here? What was he doing?

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: We don't know. They're in a room upstairs. I was told to wait down here. ABBOTT accepting that. Because he has to. Only we see the fear. Turns to leave... *  235

dialogues.speaker: ABBOTT
dialogues.text: OK, if you see Danny tell him I went back to the hotel. ABBOTT steps out into the street as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOURNE striding away and -- Following -- SIDEWALK COP blowing a WHISTLE -- fumbling for his holste BOURNE running now, slowly at first, and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now FASTER, as if he can gauge his speed and distance...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOTION -- BOURNE tearing away and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOURNE slows to a walk -- TWO PATROL CARS heading his way no choice -- there -- a narrow passageway between TWO MOVING TROLLEY TRAINS and -- SPRINTING through -- The PATROL CARS skidding into 180's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE RIVER SPREE lit by THE TROLLEY that's rumbling past a the running lights of a DOUBLE COAL BARGE up the river. BOURNE runs across the bridge -- going as fast as he can hearing THE POLICE SIRENS swirling behind him, when --

dialogues.speaker: A THIRD AND FOURTH POLICE CAR AHEAD
dialogues.text: BOURNE turns hard for a STAIRWELL, jumps the walkway curb leaps up the stairs, two at a time, as -- All FOUR COP CARS SKID to a stop. As doors open --  238 239 240 87.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TRAM waiting as the LAST FEW PASSENGERS get on. The doors seem to stay open in slow motion as -- BOURNE appears -- makes a mad last dash -- And he's on! And the doors don't close! It's not scheduled to go yet. And here come the COPS! BOURNE off the tram -- GUNS appear -- BOURNE runs to his left -- stops short -- The other cops are coming this way -- SCREAMING at him -- Not a lot of options -- BOURNE looks over the rail --

dialogues.speaker: DOWN BELOW
dialogues.text: A COAL BARGE passing, the prow just emerging --

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: On the rail and JUMPING even as the FIRST SHOT is fired -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOURNE lands hard -- stands -- voltage going up one leg - And they're SHOOTING at him. He can worry about the leg later. He RUNS. Back toward them! The barge moving slow -- BOURNE disappears under the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guns aimed, POLICE waiting for a clear shot. TWO OF THEM DASH to watch over the other side.  241 242 243 245 pt 88.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Countering -- the barge going one way -- BOURNE the other dodging all the super-structure on deck -- all the while keeping his cover overhead -- And LEAPING to the second barge! And more of the same, until -- BOURNE running out of barge -- LEAPING back onto the BRIDGE FOOTING and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE POLICE watching the barge fully emerge -- continuing down river -- SHOUTING IN GERMAN that he's either "in the water" or "hiding on the barge". Off they go -- down the stairs -- Leaving the PASSENGERS on the tram blinking out in shock And BOURNE -- climbing back over the rail -- Limping back on the tram just before -- The DOORS CLOSE -- and off it goes --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POLICE converge from both ends -- Barge goes under as KIRILL arrives at the center of the bridge -- missed again -- behind KIRILL, a train snakes off into the night... INT. ROOM #645 -- HOTEL BRECKER -- NIGHT 245 pt

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAMELA and CRONIN move into the living room. A couple of COPS in the hallway outside.

dialogues.speaker: CRONIN
dialogues.text: The room he checked into was across the hall -- why, why would he come here? PAMELA glances around -- something bothering her about this space --  246-247 245 pt 253 89.

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: He must've had a reason. That's how they were trained. CRONIN moves around the bedroom, then into the bathroom and --

dialogues.speaker: CRONIN
dialogues.text: He went out the window in here...

dialogues.speaker: DELETED 246-247
dialogues.text: INT. ROOM #645 -- BATHROOM -- NIGHT 245 pt There on the mirror -- scrawled in soap on the glass...

dialogues.speaker: CRONIN
dialogues.text: Pam, you need to see this. PAMELA moves in behind him.

dialogues.speaker: CRONIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Who's Neski? Both of them staring.

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: (thinking) Alright...take it down.

dialogues.speaker: CRONIN
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: This stays between you and I. (sensing confusion) We finally have an edge. I don't want to lose it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very late -- ABBOTT waits on an isolated bridge -- a lone figure in the shadow of East Berlin. GRETKOV arrives by car. Walks through the darkness. ABBOTT barely glancing over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ee eK  90.

dialogues.speaker: ABBOTT
dialogues.text: You told me Bourne was dead.

dialogues.speaker: GRETKOV
dialogues.text: There was a mistake.

dialogues.speaker: ABBOTT
dialogues.text: I'll say. You killed his goddam girlfriend instead. Now they're onto Neski. They're at the Brecker Hotel even as we speak.

dialogues.speaker: GRETKOV
dialogues.text: Will it track back to us?

dialogues.speaker: ABBOTT
dialogues.text: No. The files are spotless. Whatever they find, it's just going to make Conklin look worse.

dialogues.speaker: GRETKOV
dialogues.text: And the Landy woman?

dialogues.speaker: ABBOTT
dialogues.text: She's done everything I wanted. She bit on Conklin so fast it was laughable. She even found his bogus Swiss account...

dialogues.speaker: GRETKOV
dialogues.text: Anything else? ABBOTT shoves a piece of paper -- and ADDRESS -- into GRETKOV'S hand.

dialogues.speaker: ABBOTT
dialogues.text: (the paper) There's a body in the basement. Danny Zorn. He's got to disappear. For good. Clean and fast. I'11l put him in bed with Conklin and Bourne. Even the girl, Nicky. Give me twenty-four hours, I'll think it up. But get the goddamn body out of there. It's getting late. A taxi now and then...

dialogues.speaker: ABBOTT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Neski was a roadblock. Without me, there's no company, no fortune. You owe me, Uri. One last push.

dialogues.speaker: GRETKOV
dialogues.text: One last push. One. ee eK

dialogues.speaker: A248
dialogues.text: 248 91. GRETKOV leaves. ABBOTT watches him go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seconds later. GRETKOV getting in slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KIRILL slouched in back. Waiting. Gretkov to the DRIVER.

dialogues.speaker: GRETKOV
dialogues.text: (Airport. ) (to Kirill) (We're done here.) KIRILL nods. As they pull away, ABBOTT turns and walks into the foggy night...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Late. ABBOTT walks. A lonely figure. Past someone in the shadows --

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: Mr. Abbott? He turns to answer when BOURNE firmly guides him into a side street...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As PAMELA and CRONIN exit the elevator, they are met by TEDDY.

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: Here's what I've got. (reads ) Remember Vladimir Neski? Russian politician? Seven years ago, he was due to speak to a group of European Oil ministers here at the hotel. He never did. He was murdered.

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: By who? ee eK

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: His wife. In room 645. Then she shot herself. (Pamela and Cronin share a look)

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: (to Teddy) Alright...I want you, Kurt and Kim to stay on Bourne, track everything that's out there... TEDDY goes to get in the van. PAMELA follows with CRONIN.

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (confidentially to Cronin) And I want you to go through and cross reference our buy that went bad, the Neskis, and Treadstone -- As they get in...

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: -- they have to be related.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOURNE'S ARRIVED. Limping. As he continues for the station --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOURNE retrieving the exfil bag he stashed in the locker. Changed his clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bag slung -- limping out -- BOURNE has changed clothes. A big overcoat, knit cap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A busy midnight departure. Big train. BOURNE climbing on the train, under the sign:

dialogues.speaker: MOSCOW EXPRESS
dialogues.text: ee eK a ae ee

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BLUEPRINT spread across a table. NICKY, KURT & KIM all gathered around. CRONIN works the TREADSTONE files on another table. TEDDY at center briefing PAMELA.

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: We're looking at all Berlin outbound. Good news is, every train station in Berlin has thirty to forty fixed, digital security cameras. Common feed.

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: Are we hacking or asking?

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: Yes. In that order.

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: And what about you, anything?

dialogues.speaker: CRONIN
dialogues.text: It's starting to link up -- the hijacked money -- the leak -- Pecos Oil -- one last bit is Treadstone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crossing the border into Poland -- Cold, desolate, snow -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONDUCTORS moving quietly through the dark cars. Checking tickets and visas and -- BOURNE -- hands over his ticket and RUSSIAN PASSPORT -- o the grid --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4:00 am. KURT, KIM, and TEDDY spread around the room. They've been running laptop train station videos for hours. Just about ready to raise the white flag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ee eK
All they have so far is an isolated loop of BOURNE limpin into the men's room. Cronin watches it stutter along.

dialogues.speaker: CRONIN
dialogues.text: Does it look like he's faking?

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: On the way in? Forget it.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: The leg's definitely hurt.

dialogues.speaker: CRONIN
dialogues.text: (the blueprint) Well, there's no window in the men's room, folks, so let's find somebody coming out with a bad left leg.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: (worn out) Maybe he's still in there.

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: I've got a limping guy, but it's the right leg.

dialogues.speaker: KIM
dialogues.text: Walking away, or walking toward you? CRONIN jumping on that, right there, over TEDDY'S shoulde

dialogues.speaker: CRONIN
dialogues.text: That's him. It's the coat! What train is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOURNE -- asleep in his chair -- rocked by the rhythm. Bu something wakes him up. Looks out the window -- something weird about the light o there -- then up to see: MARIE -- looking at him over the back of his chair in fro of him -- no big deal --

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: Hey... She smiles. A beat. She comes around, sits beside him. He looks away out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ee eK

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I wanted to kill him.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: But you found another choice.

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: I did.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: It wouldn't have changed the way you feel.

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: It might have. BOURNE looks back at her. She smiles. He accepts it, leans back, closes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I know it's a dream.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: You do?

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: I only dream about people who are dead. MARIE leans over, kisses his forehead. Whispers --

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: God, I miss you. I don't know what to do without you.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: (softly, serenely) Jason. You know exactly what to do. That is your mission now. BOURNE opens his eyes. And it's morning outside. And Marie is gone. A LITTLE GIRL smiles at him from over the back of the cha in front. BOURNE can't meet her gaze for long. As he looks back out the window --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOURNE watching the birch trees rush past, not quite hidi the smokestacks beyond. Eyes locked. Forging something within, one final mission, as we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABBOTT coming through. It's empty this early, but -- Here's PAMELA, NICKY, CRONIN and the TEAM waiting to report.

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: Sorry to wake you.

dialogues.speaker: ABBOTT
dialogues.text: (waves off apology) I wasn't sleeping. (to Nicky as he passes) You OK?

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Yeah, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: ABBOTT
dialogues.text: What's up?

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: Bunch of stuff. PAMELA looks to CRONIN -- him first.

dialogues.speaker: CRONIN
dialogues.text: We tied the room Bourne visited tonight to a murder/suicide seven years ago. A Russian couple, the Neskis.

dialogues.speaker: ABBOTT
dialogues.text: (playing along) Neski. The reformer. I remember that.

dialogues.speaker: CRONIN
dialogues.text: He championed the equal distribution of oil leases in the Caspian Sea. When he died, they were all released to one petroleum company, Pecos Oil. Guess what? -- the CEO, Uri Gretkov, is ex- KGB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He He HK

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Someone was using Treadstone as a private cleaning service.

dialogues.speaker: ABBOTT
dialogues.text: Conklin... (a beat) It's -- I'm sorry, Pamela. I guess you were right all along. Pamela waves him off, it's okay, but --

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: There's something else. Abbott can see by their faces: this hits closer to home.

dialogues.speaker: ABBOTT
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: They found Danny Zorn's body. Dead in the basement at the building where my people got hit the first time.

dialogues.speaker: ABBOTT
dialogues.text: Oh, God... It must have been Bourne.

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: Did he say anything to you?

dialogues.speaker: ABBOTT
dialogues.text: No... It must have been Bourne. PAMELA, straight...

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: We'll know for sure when we get the security tapes.

dialogues.speaker: CRONIN
dialogues.text: But we can relax. We tracked him. He's on a train to Moscow. ABBOTT reeling, hiding it.

dialogues.speaker: ABBOTT
dialogues.text: Moscow? What the Hell's he going to Moscow for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He eH HK  98.

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Don't know.

dialogues.speaker: ABBOTT
dialogues.text: Jesus... I, Zorn... I have to call his family. Tell them...

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Ward. They watch as he goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABBOTT in the rising elevator. Imploding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Palatial. But you can't buy taste. GRETKOV working his computer -- answers his PHONE.

dialogues.speaker: GRETKOV
dialogues.text: Da...

dialogues.speaker: ABBOTT/PHONE
dialogues.text: You didn't stay, Uri.

dialogues.speaker: GRETKOV
dialogues.text: (matter of fact) This is not a clean phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone still here. CRONIN answering his cell phone -- motioning to them, he's got news --

dialogues.speaker: CRONIN
dialogues.text: (phone to his ear) You're sure?

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: What? The tapes?

dialogues.speaker: CRONIN
dialogues.text: (nodding but) Hold on... (holding the phone) Yep. And Abbott just direct dialed Moscow from his room...  268
Now we realize, she's set a trap and Abbott's walked in. All the same, Pamela shakes her head, wishes it wasn't true. And they're moving --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 268 ABBOTT at his desk, still on the phone, pouring a vodka.

dialogues.speaker: GRETKOV
dialogues.text: Leaving was a business decision. We' both rich, come enjoy it.

dialogues.speaker: ABBOTT
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: GRETKOV
dialogues.text: re Go to the airport. Get a plane. I'1l have a brass band waiting for you.

dialogues.speaker: ABBOTT
dialogues.text: Save it for Bourne.

dialogues.speaker: GRETKOV
dialogues.text: What? There's a KNOCKING AT HIS DOOR -- ABBOTT simply ignores i

dialogues.speaker: ABBOTT
dialogues.text: He left yesterday on the night train. He's probably just getting in now. (he drinks) You'll have to hurry.

dialogues.speaker: GRETKOV
dialogues.text: Bourne comes here? Why? More KNOCKING...

dialogues.speaker: ABBOTT
dialogues.text: Good luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speeding East through the Russian countryside. is gone, replaced by factories and refineries. wasteland of rust and gray that seems to go on

dialogues.speaker: A268
dialogues.text: The forest

dialogues.speaker: A
dialogues.text: forever --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAMELA knocking again. NICKY, TEDDY and CRONIN behind her

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: Open it. CRONIN with a pass key. TEDDY prepped and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAMELA leading -- they enter -- stop short -- ABBOTT at his desk, calmly pointing a PISTOL -- at Pamela

dialogues.speaker: ABBOTT
dialogues.text: They go. You stay. She looks back. CRONIN shakes his head 'no'.

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: Yes. Now... They reluctantly obey. The door clicking shut behind them

dialogues.speaker: ABBOTT
dialogues.text: Sit down.

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: I'd rather stand if it's all the same to you.

dialogues.speaker: ABBOTT
dialogues.text: I don't exactly know what to say -- I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: ‘Why' would be enough for me.

dialogues.speaker: ABBOTT
dialogues.text: I'm not a traitor. I've served my country.

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: And pocketed a fair amount of change while doing it.

dialogues.speaker: ABBOTT
dialogues.text: Why not? It was just money.  270 271 101.

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: And Danny Zorn, what was that?

dialogues.speaker: ABBOTT
dialogues.text: Had to be done.

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: No good options left?

dialogues.speaker: ABBOTT
dialogues.text: (shrugs) In the end, honestly, it's hubris. Simple hubris. You reach a point in this game when the only satisfaction left is to see how clever you are.

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: No. You lost your way.

dialogues.speaker: ABBOTT
dialogues.text: Well, you're probably right. I guess that's all that hubris is. He raises the gun. PAMELA -- presses her lips together, closes her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: BOOM
dialogues.text: She opens them. And as CRONIN flies back through the door There's ABBOTT -- dead at the desk -- he's shot himself - also, in a way, with some help from Bourne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE TRAIN easing to a stop. The platform busy with people waiting and -- PASSENGERS disembarking. BOURNE among them. Unremarkable in THE CROWD and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOURNE on the move. Welcome to the whole mad Moscow scene A jumble of faces and voices. Travellers. Arrivals and departures. Families. Beggars. Drunk war vets. Hawkers. Ce

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There, in the plaza. BOURNE hobbling across the street, when suddenly -- A CAR HORN! -- he turns and -- Look out! A BIG BLACK BMW speeding past -- followed by TWO MORE -- all three cars with BLUE LIGHTS STROBING on the dashboard - a convoy -- whipping by like they own the place and --

dialogues.speaker: TAXI DRIVER, (OS)
dialogues.text: (Gangster bastards don't care what they do.) BOURNE turns. A grizzled TAXI DRIVER right beside him. BOURNE pulls a slip of paper from his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: (his Russian is basic) (You know this address?) THE TAXI DRIVER squints, finally grunts affirmative. He motions to his cab. As they get in and pull away --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lots of cars. No people. But someone running... It's KIRILL pulling his keys as he sprints past and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOURNE and THE TAXI DRIVER looking over as THREE MOSCOW POLICE CARS speed by -- SIRENS WAILING --

dialogues.speaker: TAXI DRIVER
dialogues.text: (It's always something, right?) BOURNE just nods, as we --  276 277 278 279 280 103.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KIRILL at the wheel. A guy in a hurry who knows what he's doing. One more thing, on the passenger seat -- TWO BIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOSCOW COPS fanning through the crowd showing BOURNE'S INTERPOL PICTURE. "Have you seen him?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOSCOW COPS with the picture. Flashing it around, until -

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG CABBY
dialogues.text: (the moment he sees it) (He was just here. They just left.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've stopped. BOURNE flashes a FIFTY DOLLAR BILL --

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: You wait. You understand? Stay.

dialogues.speaker: TAXI DRIVER
dialogues.text: (happy to pocket the cash) Sure. No problem. I sit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old Moscow. But not for long, there's new construction metastasizing all around it. BOURNE crosses the street an

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AN ABANDONED WOODEN HOUSE. Windows shattered and boarded up. Paint all but gone. Roof and gables all failing.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO
dialogues.text: BOURNE crestfallen. Checking the address. This is it.  104.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MORE COPS. Everything focused on ANOTHER TAXI DRIVER who' making a call on a cell phone -- everybody waiting on it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOURNE off the sidewalk now, peering around the side, trying to see if there's anything around back and --

dialogues.speaker: OVER THERE
dialogues.text: AN OLD WOMAN on the steps next door. Watching him. BOURNE starts over. Finding the sweetest smile he's got -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE TAXI DRIVER still parked there --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOURNE and the OLD LADY -- she's pointing like she's givi directions -- when suddenly, the Driver's CELL PHONE RING

dialogues.speaker: TAXI DRIVER/PHONE
dialogues.text: (Hello...?)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOURNE and the OLD LADY. His Russian is limited, but she' charmed nonetheless --

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: (A pen...to write...one minute...) (searching his pockets)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE TAXI DRIVER on the phone -- not so happy anymore --

dialogues.speaker: TAXI DRIVER
dialogues.text: (-- I'm looking at him -- American -- he's right here! --)  286 287 288 289 290 291 292 293 294 105.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE OLD LADY scribbling on a piece of paper. BOURNE reacting as the TAXI drops into gear. Pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: Wait! Hey! But THE TAXI only speeds up, and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOSCOW POLICE CARS tearing away and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KIRILL DRIVING. Reaching for his RINGING PHONE and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BLACK BMW -- a moment later -- slamming on the brakes fishtailing a U-TURN and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOURNE hustling past all the new construction. Glancing back as POLICE SIRENS start rising behind him and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KIRILL skidding around another corner and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO POLICE CARS just stopped there -- COPS -- the OLD LAD pointing -- everyone turning as -- THE RED LEXUS speeds past them and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOURNE coming down as fast as he can -- just ahead there' A FOOTPATH BENEATH A FOUR LANE OVERPASS -- a neighborhood on the other side -- he could disappear there --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KIRILL driving and scanning -- THERE! -- as he passes it THE OVERPASS -- slamming on the brakes and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOURNE hobbling out in the open -- twenty yards to go --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KIRILL jumping out of the Lexus with A PISTOL in hand and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOURNE -- no clue -- BANG! -- his shoulder! -- he's hit! he throws himself forward and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KIRILL shifting for a better second shot and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOURNE -- he's diving! -- rolling! -- pure instinct -- ba under the embankment and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KIRILL with no shot suddenly -- leaning over the rail -- just as the TWO MOSCOW POLICE CARS come screaming up -- MOSCOW COPS jumping out with guns drawn and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOURNE -- he's up -- he's bleeding -- he's moving and --  304

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHAOS -- KIRILL with his hands in the air -- MOSCOW COPS coming toward him -- everyone screaming --

dialogues.speaker: DROP IT
dialogues.text: They let KIRILL go -- he looks back at the footpath -- BOURNE is gone -- as

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRETKOV strolls along, suddenly two black sedans pull up and he is arrested.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOURNE hurriedly makes his way to the other end -- a few beats later -- KIRILL on the hunt --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A labyrinth of stalls. Food. Hardware. Clothes. And crowded. Even this hard-to-impress CROWD noticing -- BOURNE hobbling through. Nothing like a limping madman with a fresh gunshot wound to get attention -- PEOPLE back off -- pull THEIR KIDS out of the way -- SOME WOMAN STARTS SCREAMING and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SECURITY GUARD -- hears the commotion -- jogs out and -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KIRILL running toward the market -- FIVE MOSCOW COPS behi him, can't keep up and --  309 310 311 312 313-314 315 316 317 108.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE SECURITY GUARD coming up fast behind BOURNE --

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: (-- hey! -- hey you! -- stop! --) BOURNE turns. THE SECURITY GUARD right behind him and -- BOURNE -- no warning -- his good arm -- SMASH!!! -- right into THE SECURITY GUARD'S FACE and -- BOURNE takes HIS PISTOL and -- THE CROWD -- they jump -- holy shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crazy -- KIRILL sprinting through -- where did Bourne go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOURNE back on the march, except now he's shopping! -- Grabbing -- A BUNDLE OF TUBE SOCKS and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KIRILL sprinting out toward the stalls and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOURNE -- THERE! -- A ROLL OF DUCT TAPE and -- -- A BOTTLE OF VODKA and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KIRILL fighting his way through THE FLEEING CROWD --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 318 pt 1 EXT. MOSCOW OUTDOOR MARKET -- DAY 318 pt 1 BOURNE -- leaving the market -- taking a swig of VODKA an Continues -- knows there are TWO NEW COPS on his ass. 318 pt 2 EXT. MARKET PARKING LOT -- DAY 318 pt 2 Another CAB STAND. CABBIE by a YELLOW CAB, looks up to se BOURNE -- coming toward him -- and also -- The TWO COPS. As BOURNE nears, the CABBIE shakes his head Bourne pivots -- casually -- like he doesn't know they're coming until -- HE SPITS! -- VODKA -- into one of the cop face! -- blinded as BOURNE takes him and his PARTNER out. The CABBIE raises his hands in surrender, steps aside as BOURNE takes his car -- 318 pt 3 INT./EXT. CAB -- DAY 318 pt 3 BOURNE IN THE YELLOW CAB -- starting THE ENGINE -- peelin away! -- careening into the street and -- KIRILL sprinting into the parking lot, just in time to se 318 pt 4 INT. CAB -- DAY 318 pt 4 BOURNE concentrating away the pain -- trying to drive --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO LADIES ducked behind a BIG BLACK G-WAGON -- freaked o as KIRILL grabs their keys and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE CAB speeding across A BOULEVARD into an older neighborhood of rising narrow streets and -- TWO MOSCOW POLICE CARS PULLING U-TURNS on the BOULEVARD - whipping around to give chase and --  110. THE G-WAGON in full pursuit now and -- BOURNE DRIVING -- up this curving little hill and -- THE TWO MOSCOW POLICE CARS starting to climb and -- KIRILL DRIVING and he's on the hill now -- BOURNE -- bad hand on the wheel -- holding on -- trying t find something in passenger seat -- TUBE SOCKS? THE TWO MOSCOW POLICE CARS splitting up! -- one on Bourne ass -- the other cutting hard into A SIDE STREET, flankin him and -- BOURNE -- topping the hill -- two choices -- right or lef RIGHT! -- No! -- wrong -- because down the hill there's A POLICE CAR just about to angle in from THE SIDE-STREET an BOURNE -- no choice -- FLOORING IT! -- THE CAB -- it's a whale -- SLAM! -- knifing the front end of THE POLICE CAR and -- THE POLICE CAR -- spun back! -- CRASHING AGAINST A BUILDI ON THE CORNER and -- KIRILL -- right behind that guy -- swerving -- onto the sidewalk -- SPARKS FROM THE WALL AS HE SCRAPES! -- hangin in -- skidding into a turn down the hill and -- JUST MISSING THE FIRST POLICE CAR bombing right past him! BOURNE -- in pain as he packs his shoulder wound with the socks -- Ahead -- the street banks downhill to left and - THERE! -- A BOULEVARD -- wide ride -- lots of traffic and THE CAB rocketing into the flow and -- BEHIND HIM -- POLICE CAR #1 with THE G-WAGON right on his ass and -- BOURNE -- Wrists flicking the wheel. THE CAB screaming through the slower traffic and -- KIRILL -- totally on it -- pedal down -- passenger window open -- wind blowing -- he's got THE PISTOL in his hand - closing the gap and -- THE BLACK G-WAGON -- blowing past POLICE CAR #1 and --  336-337 111. BOURNE -- steering -- barely -- as he tears a few strips DUCT TAPE to finish his triage -- BLAM! -- BLAM!! -- THE G-WAGON -- right beside him! -- BOURNE -- reacting -- what the fuck?! -- that's not a cop - but no time to clock Kirill because -- KIRILL -- shit! -- can't keep shooting -- into the oncomi lanes -- swinging wide -- A TRUCK! -- swerving again and THE CAB -- wavering again -- rallying and -- UP AHEAD -- THE BOULEVARD opens into THE RIVER BELTWAY -- big -- wide -- fast -- KREMLIN in the BG and -- FOUR NEW POLICE CARS screaming down from RED SQUARE and - BOURNE skidding onto THE BELTWAY -- looking for room -- -- Finding it -- open road -- KIRILL back in the hunt and -- THE RIVER BELTWAY -- CAB SCREAMING PAST -- then ONE -- TW - THREE -- FOUR POLICE CARS -- now the BLACK G-WAGON and BOURNE -- Both hands on the wheel -- He's already forgott about his shoulder -- THE BELTWAY -- up ahead -- ANOTHER CHOICE -- right takes you up to the city -- left is a TRANSIT TUNNEL and -- BOURNE -- checking his rearview -- starting right and -- THE TWO LEAD POLICE CARS right on his ass and -- BOURNE -- fake out -- veering left! -- last second -- int THE TUNNEL and -- THE TWO LEAD POLICE CARS -- wrong -- and worse, trying to change -- CRASH!!!! -- SPINNING -- and it's not just them A THIRD POLICE CAR caught in the clutter -- Not to mentio the COMMUTERS -- CRASH!!! The Police are out of the race. KIRILL -- not fooled -- threading the needle -- through t carnage and into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ee eK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOUR LANES -- two way -- and long -- there's -- THE CAB -- squibbing past SLOWER CARS and -- KIRILL on him -- move for move -- follow the leader and - BOURNE -- checks the rearview -- he's lost them all but t G-WAGON -- who the hell is that? -- The Heavyweights. World Championship Belt up for grabs. KIRILL -- gaining -- nearly pulling level. BOURNE -- nowhere to go -- that's never stopped him befor - he carves a path -- turns two lanes into three as sparks his way through a lane split -- THE G-WAGON -- roaring after him. BOURNE -- checks the mirror -- closer -- who the Hell is that guy? -- KIRILL -- Gaining -- FIRING through his passenger window.

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: TUNNEL -- As the two vehicles scrape along each other -- KIRILL -- FIRING BACK -- odd angle -- BOURNE -- ducking for meager cover as bullets stitch through the roof -- TUNNEL -- The G-WAGON crushes the CAB against the wall -- sparks showering the windshield -- finally -- THE CAB -- shoots ahead -- KIRILL -- in a controlled fury -- THE SUV -- jerking hard and right into the rear of the CA BOURNE -- trying to keep control -- spots a MAINTENANCE TRUCK up ahead -- KIRILL -- banging away as his quarry straightens -- MAINTENANCE TRUCK -- looming --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOURNE -- a hard left -- TUNNEL -- the CAB wrapping around the front of the SUV -- WHAM! -- pushing it to the right -- the cab continues -- SPINNING around the G-WAGON -- DETAILS -- front bumpers locking on rear fenders as -- TUNNEL -- The G-WAGON hurtling forward -- the CAB ass end first -- locked together -- KIRILL -- firing into the CAB -- really unloading now -- BOURNE -- down on the floor -- a tornado overhead -- KIRILL -- slaps in a new clip -- intense -- BOURNE -- gun against his door -- just below the window knob -- WHUMP-WHUMP-WHUMP -- SUV TIRE -- shredding. KIRILL -- fights the wheel -- ANOTHER TRUCK -- looming large -- BOURNE -- looking between the seats out the rear window - a LANE DIVIDING PILLAR ahead -- CAB -- as BOURNE sits up -- jerks the wheel to the right TUNNEL -- the cars unlock -- spin away from each other -- KIRILL -- focused -- taking deadly aim -- BOURNE -- staring back at him -- calm -- "I know somethin you don't know." KIRILL -- frowns -- THE TRUCK -- swerves to reveal the PILLAR to Kirill's POV KIRILL -- eyes go wide -- WHALLOP! -- steel vs. concrete -- concrete victorious -- bone compressing, truly horrendous impact! BOURNE -- whipping the wheel -- CAB -- spinning to a stop out of harm's way -- door openi  339 340-350

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gun ready -- BOURNE heads over. Ahead -- Spam in a can. BOURNE crouches down -- looks in. KIRILL -- bloody, beat-to-crap -- barely alive -- but -- trapped -- entombed alive by the metal crushed around him BOURNE -- watches. Not here to help. KIRILL -- looks over -- calms a moment as the two men consider each other -- BOURNE looks at him long and hard. Kirill dies. And BOURNE stands -- and just walks away --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snow swirls. PAMELA disembarks from the G-5 (or US military plane). She is met by RUSSIAN OFFICIALS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huge, awful Soviet-era housing towers fill the horizon. A CITY BUS grinds to a stop. PEOPLE trundle off. Working people at the end of their day. Tired. Cold.

dialogues.speaker: THE CAMERA FOLLOWS
dialogues.text: A GIRL. Trudging a man-made wasteland. Twenty. A proud little waif. Sad eyes. Home from some job. IRENA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grimmer up close. Rusted steel mesh over the windows. DRUNK TEENAGERS. A haze of cigarette smoke. IRENA pushing through. Doesn't want to talk to anyone --  115.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IRENA climbing. A JUNKIE here. Flickering light there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IRENA -- her key at the door. Domestic disturbance playin across the hall. She opens up and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's dark. And she's barely through the door when -- IRENA jumps -- chokes back a CRY -- BOURNE is standing there -- propped there actually -- behind her -- gun in hand -- motioning for her to be quie

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: (his shabby Russian) (Quiet. Silence. Okay?) IRENA nods. Scared. Gun in hand, BOURNE pushes the door the last few inches so it's fully closed.

dialogues.speaker: IRENA
dialogues.text: (I have no money. No drugs. Is that what you want?) And now she can really see him. He's a disaster. Shivering. Bloody. Eyes more hollow than hers are.

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: Sit. Can you... (trying to conjure the Russian--) (The chair. Have the chair.)

dialogues.speaker: IRENA
dialogues.text: (accented) I speak English. BOURNE staring at her. Nods. Gestures for her to sit.

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: Please... So she does. And here they are.  116. BOURNE (CONT'D) (cont'd) Of all the people in the world, you're the only one I have anything to offer. (hesitating) That's why I came here.

dialogues.speaker: IRENA
dialogues.text: (she's terrified) Okay. He's got something beside him. Something he's taken off the wall. IT'S THE PHOTOGRAPH. The Neski family. Same as the one that was in the Hotel Brecker. Mom, Dad and Irena arms around each other, in front of the house. Before it was abandoned. Happy. Smiling. Perfect.

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: It's nice. (a beat) Does this picture mean anything to you? (no answer) Hmm?

dialogues.speaker: IRENA
dialogues.text: It's nothing. It's just a picture.

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: No. It's because you don't know how they died.

dialogues.speaker: IRENA
dialogues.text: (he couldn't understand) No, I do. A change in BOURNE as he studies her, measures her. Some moment of truth is here. IRENA braces, unsure.

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: I would want to know. (beat) I would want to know that my mother didn't kill my father. I would want to know that she didn't kill herself.

dialogues.speaker: IRENA
dialogues.text: What? She really looks at him now. Fear overwhelmed by curiosity.

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: I would grow up thinking that they didn't love me if they just left me like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irena making sure her eyes don't leave his. They don't. BOURNE (CONT'D) (cont'd) It changes things. That knowledge. Doesn't it?

dialogues.speaker: IRENA
dialogues.text: (wary) Yes...

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: That's not what happened to your parents.

dialogues.speaker: IRENA
dialogues.text: Then what?

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: I killed them. Body blows, but he has her attention. She wipes a tear.

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It was my job. My first time. Your father was supposed to be alone. But then your mother, she came out of nowhere... (a little shrug) I had to change my plan. (beat) You understand me? (does she?) You don't have to live like that anymore. Thinking that.

dialogues.speaker: IRENA
dialogues.text: You killed them. BOURNE nods, that's right.

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: They loved you. (beat) And I killed them.

dialogues.speaker: IRENA
dialogues.text: How...how can...how can you be here and * say this? *

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: I don't want you to forgive me. * She stands suddenly. Stands because if she doesn't she'll burst into tears. Because she knows if she starts crying she won't be able to make sense of this.  118.

dialogues.speaker: IRENA
dialogues.text: For who? (he doesn't answer)

dialogues.speaker: KILLED FOR WHO
dialogues.text: BOURNE pushes himself to his feet. A real effort.

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter. Your life is hard enough.

dialogues.speaker: IRENA
dialogues.text: You're a liar.

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: You know I'm not.

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: Look at _me. There they are. Two people standing in a room. Squared off. And now she starts crying. Really crying. And he's taking it.

dialogues.speaker: IRENA
dialogues.text: I should kill you...if it's true you should die...I should kill you now!

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: I can't let you do that either.

dialogues.speaker: IRENA
dialogues.text: Because you're afraid!

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: No. (starting for the door) Because you don't want to know how it feels. She hesitates. Stunned. He's leaving. He's opening the door.

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I have to go now.

dialogues.speaker: IRENA
dialogues.text: Is this really happening?

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: (empty ) I'm sorry. And she sags. Back into the chair, as --

dialogues.speaker: THE CAMERA FINDS
dialogues.text: THE PHOTOGRAPH on the table. The sound of the door closing and Irena crying, as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOURNE trudging along. Across the snow. He's done it. And he really can't take another step. There's a bench. He sits down. Out of gas. He just might die here. We slowly tilt up to the multi- colored Moscow tenements.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOURNE waking up -- sitting up -- where is he? -- trying get his bearings -- but it's so bright -- white walls -- sheets -- SUNSHINE through clean windows and --

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA, (OS)
dialogues.text: Hello, David. There she is. Standing at the foot of his bed.

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: Where am I?

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: Ramstein Air Base, Germany. (smiles) Before the wall fell you would have woken up in a Russian prison hospital. He looks around -- tries to move -- hammered by pain.

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: Oh, shit...

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: Careful...  120. Long moment. He's taking it in. Trying to.

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: Why am I alive?

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: Are you disappointed? They study each other a beat.

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: I know who you are. PAMELA nods. Very calm here. No sudden movements.

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: Thank you for your gift. I'm sorry about Marie.

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: Do you think you can read? Are you well enough? She has a folder. A PHOTOGRAPH -- Bourne's face -- staple to the cover.

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's all in here. Treadstone. A summary of your life. All of it. He waves it off.

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: Don't need it. I remember everything.

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: (smiles again) Sounds like a threat.

dialogues.speaker: BOURNE
dialogues.text: You didn't answer my question.

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: Why you're alive? (beat) You're alive because you're special. Because she kept you alive. (she smiles) Because we want you back on our side. BOURNE silent. But hearing it. PAMELA leaves the file.  358 359 360 121. PAMELA (cont'd) (CONT'D) Take a look at it. We'll talk later. BOURNE watching her back away. As she exits into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long, sterile hallway. CRONIN and NICKY standing there with an AIR FORCE SENTRY assigned to guard the room. CRONIN and NICKY trying to play it cool, but now, as they get some distance down the hallway --

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: (to the sentry) * Let's give him half an hour. *

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: (quietly) So?

dialogues.speaker: PAMELA
dialogues.text: Felt promising. It's a start. * A chill in the air. Both of them going quiet because there's A NURSE carrying a tray of food. She's coming toward us. They're walking away.

dialogues.speaker: THE CAMERA
dialogues.text: Staying with THE NURSE now. Coming up the hall. THE SENTRY smiles -- opens the door and she enters --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empty bed. Open window. Bourne is gone. As THE MUSIC STARTS PUMPING, and we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off he goes. Disappearing into thin air... *
